number of helpful: 5 of 6 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 18, 2014
												This game used to be awesome. Keywords are 'used to'. Now it's just a circlejerk of hackers, rerollers - experienced players who make new characters 'cos can, troll characters - characters that are meant to look as hideous as possible, and a company that does a really poor job of not only getting rid of the hackers - they usually just ban innocent players - but making the game run well. It runs on an outdated engine and is poorly optimized. I have state-of-the-art hardware in my computer, and even with the graphics turned up to the fullest there is still aliasing, texture and animation problems. The company who owns this game, GamersFirst - they didn't make the game, but instead revived it from the company who originally created the game but had to shut down for some reason, can't even make good content for the game. The last, like, four weapons they've added have been reskins of existing weapons. But these ones you can only get by spending REAL MONEY to get, and it's not cheap either. Permenant weapons for a single character are forty dollars. FORTY DOLLARS. I could buy a completely new game with that.The thing this game does well at is the customization, my God is it amazing... Only if you are a wizard at making symbols; otherwise you look absolutely stupid. The designers for symbols and themes - you can make a five second tune, usually an ear-piercing screech, that someone hears when you kill them or become MVP - aren't the most user friendly, and because of that there are only a handfull of people who can decently make them.The gameplay is really repetitive and grindy; do the objectives and shoot the bad guys. The objectives don't mean crap, though. You can do all the objectives, but if you don't kill anyone you get barely anything. You level up at a snail's pace unless you, or course, spend REAL MONEY to get Premium, which allows you to get insane bonuses - something like 200% - to money and experience incomes. I started playing this game right around the time it came out, and it was fun for a while, but for the past year the only thing that has kept me playing is the hope that GamersFirst would do SOMETHING to fix this crap-heap of a game. I would not reccomend you play it. If you do play it, however, do NOT spend any money on this game - it's dying, and fast.

content:
Posted: March 7, 2016
												This is the best worst game I've ever played. The highs are very high, and the lows are very frequent.  This game is like heroin. Once you've played it for a while, it's very hard to quit. Despire what some people are saying cheating isn't as common as they say. Having spent 3000-3500 hours playing this game, I can say that from experience. There have been more than a few closets and quite a few blatants, that's true. But it's not nearly as bad as it seems. Most of the "cheaters" are people who've spent 1000+ hours and are in 3rd party VOIP (IE Mumble, TS, or Vent) communcating. I've been hackusated many times for things like that. As an experienced player you gain a sense of what your opponent is going to do, and if you react to what your instincs tell you, half the time you'll get a hackusation.  The game also has more than a few bugs. Sometimes you'll literally see players names through a wall for no apparent reason, Or a wall will simply not load immediately letting you see through it. While I'm not sure if I could recommend it to friends anymore, I definitely enjoy the game. The few friends I've tried to get into it have played about 20 missions and then quit because they ended up against premade teams that absolutely wreck them, over and over and over and over again.

												The game in it's current state, I definitely cannot recommend. It has some pretty awesome customization, but thats honestly about all that keeps me coming back. The matchmaking is terrible, and there has only been cash shop item releases (no new real content) since G1 took over. They say proper new content will be possible once they finish the engine upgrade, but they've been promiseing the upgrade for 3+ years and it still seems it'll never be here. They also plan to overhaul the matchmaking system, which will definitely help keep new players around, as the system they have in place now is often exploited by veterans, and will end up matching them against newbies. With the fairly steep and long learning curve the game has, few will stick around to get the hang of it after getting steamrolled constantly.tl;drI would recommend this game once the matchmaking has been overhauled, and the engine upgraded, but in it's current state, it's skippable.

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												APB Reloaded is a cops and robbers MMO that couldn't quite pull it off. The game has SO much potential that it almost makes me angry when they fall short on almost every game features. The lack of locational damage means accuracy is not needed. Combat often ends in a jumping match, and corner camping is one of the few strategies thanks to the third person camera. The games micro transaction system and F2P model are majorly flawed. When buying guns in game you rent them allowing you to use it for a set amount of time before you have to rent it again. Buying an account bound weapon costs more but allows any of your characters to use it. This will run you anywhere from 20-55 dollars. You can also purchase character bound weapons for less, these cost about 10-40 dollars. When buying cars you can do the same rent, or own. An account bound car will run you about  15-35 dollars. All of these prices can be discounted by owning a premium subscription. Other premium benefits include a 20% off the cost of premium subscriptions, up to a 90% bonus to all Contact Standing (XP) Gains, 125% bonus to all Cash gains, 20% discount in the Armas Marketplace, 50% reduced cool down on activated abilities (Field Supplier / Nitro Booster), advanced access to Customization Suites (50 Symbols per Vehicle / Clothing item. 100 layers per Symbol), removal of in-game premium subscription advertising (which pops up at the end of every other mission), extended duration for Armas Trials for Weapon and Vehicle Trials.Premium costs about 10 dollars for 30 days and gets cheaper the more time you buy. All in game prices are set in G1C which come in inconvenient amounts to make you buy more or additional packs. An example of this is a non-premium 1 month subscription costs 999 points. You can only get 999 points by buying spending $15 (1200 credits) because $10 is only 800 credits.The best part of this 3rd person MMO shooter is the customization. While it is extremely limited as a non-premium user you can still add some flavor to your character or vehicle. Premium allows for you to create a truly unique look with 50 Symbols per Vehicle / Clothing item. At 100 layers per Symbol. The in game missions are not over exciting and after playing for about 2-3 hours you will have played all of the available missions. Other players not in your mission are still in the world and can interact with you. They can do things like ram your vehicle or block you in buildings, but it is difficult for them to directly kill you.The favored anti-cheat system of APB is Punkbuster. This program doesn't work very well at all and allows hackers to run rampant. In my short amount of play time I had encounter roughly 1 hacker per hour.Overall this game has such a great idea, yet such terrible terrible execution in nearly everything the developers tried to do.

content:
Posted: August 11, 2014
												As a start,sure it is an interesting game.After a few days it gets repetitive.From missions to customizations and so on.The game itself has a great base.Criminals against the Police,a great idea.Were the game starts to break down it is in it's execution,and the outside.In the trailers you can see that it's possible to make artwork with the creation tools.Well,yes you can,but you will soon see that it's limited,only an amount of geometric shapes you can use,same to the cars,clothes etc.One of the things that killed me is that everything was limited.I put a lot of money in this because I had hope.The matches are stupidly done.I couldn't play because it wasn't fair.They put 2 dudes with rank over 20,against 2 with over 10.The only thing that counts as "fair" is how many people vs how many people.I couldn't level up,only if I was very good at it,and I wasn't.It's the same thing,even if you are a cop or a criminal.Criminal:Go and rob something,steal a car,go to a point,capture a point,protect a point or just transport an object without the cops seeing you.Cop:Go and stop the criminals from doing all that.There is no easy way of making money since the matches are soooo unfair.Only one way and it's only for criminal(sorry cops).It's basically destroying with your car shops windows.It's a boring way,but it's worth it.The shops will drop a few objects that you have to pick up and put in a car.Then go to an AI and give the stuff,after that go to another place to get the money for it.This way I made about 20-30k a day,but again it was getting boring.I found that one thing was funny,was playing with your friends,it has a massive multiplayer.So I was actually having fun,even if I was dead or alive.The game itself has a hidden wall in front of it.It doesn't let you pass that much,most of the cool things are either for premium or they are hard to get,and only if you are good.I am not saying that you cannot get good items without paying or premium,if you are good,you can get cool items.But it's really hard to get good.When I say good I mean "super good".The game also has clans,I had one but it was pretty dumb and lame.You can make a icon for the clan and spray it on special spots in the city.And it is true that you can actually make songs.I found myself creating a lot of music,so that will be fun.This game has a short amount of "gamemodes".There are two cities,they are basically the whole game.Then there's these 2 place from both cities,where there is like a "free for all" gamemode,and the famous "Hanging Plaza".Where you create,buy,and sell.In a nutshell this game needs a lot of improvement.It is fun,but you will find it anoying after a while.So it does not worth your time.You can try playing it a few hours,but that's all.You will get bored.I must say that the game is full of glitches and bugs so watch out for that,some are funny,but some aren't.Even after many laughs it will started sucking your soul and just turn into a pain in the leg.Don't bother with putting any money in it.Play for a while and if you aren't "super good" at it,just delete the game,it will get repetitive and you will get nervous because you can't killed anybody(because all over 20).If you aren't good at beating people that have over your rank,just leave it.In the end this game is something that should'va been developed by someone else.Someone who actually knows how to make a multiplayer game.If you haven't played the game,just try it and the play something else.I played it too much,I was frustrated that I wasn't killing anybody.Warning!YOU WILL NEED A GOOD COMPUTER!If you are reading my review,just don't touch it.It doesn't worth your time,go and play GTA or Saints Row instead of this thing.So this game gets the rating of 3/10,an epic fail.The idea is good,they screwed it up.Now it's just a stupid,frustrating game that gets a lot of bad reviews.After a spoiler that it will be gta 5,and a few changes of title,all developted by someone who doesn't know how to make games like this.This is what you get,you get "A.P.B.:Reloaded".And if you say "Changes of title?".Yes,the game was once called "All Points Bulletin'"(A.P.B.).There was no "Reloaded".Go google and get more indepth informations about the past game.I don't know that much about it.SO GO AND BUY OTHER GAMES,EVEN THOUGH THIS GAME IS FREE,GO AND PLAY GTA:SA INSTEAD OF THIS CRAP!

number of helpful: 8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 26, 2014
												Although this game has lots of potential, I myself have found a few things wrong with it:Firstly, the game is simply too resource-demanding. I myself have an Alienware 14 with a NVIDIA GeForce GT 750M, and 8GB of memory. To start with, this $1,000 laptop barely even runs this game on moderate graphics settings, forcing me to switch to low-end graphics just so the game can have a smooth, playable framerate. MAYBE this is something wrong with my laptop, but I think not.Even playing on the lowest graphics settings possible, the game still manages to lag and otherwise have random FPS drops that would often result in instant death in the middle of a firefight. The vehicle control feels a little too arcade-y for my liking. In addition, there is a rather alarming population of cheaters on servers. Utilizing a mathematical formula—100 missions played, averaging 4 players to each faction for each mission—I found that over the course of those 100 missions that a total of 89 people were hacking in some way, shape, or form. If we conclude that in 100 missions that you will encounter 700 people (800 minus yourself in each mission), there is an average hacker ratio of 0.127 (12.7%). While Reloaded Production's newest Fair Fight Anti-Cheat Technology should help reduce this number, I still can see a large population of hackers managing to bypass this.Regarding the servers, their software is outdated and faulty at best. Only the dedicated servers seem to run anywhere near smoothly, but even then their calculation systems and arithmatic formulas often result in a laggy experience.Pros:Decent graphicsDynamic gameplayENDLESS character customizationCons:Requires a high-end gaming laptop in order to run smoothlyArcade-esque vehicle handlingCombat utilizes hit-scans, which often bugsOutdated serversHigh hacker populationOverall score: 5.1/10.This game USED to be fun, but sadly, they have moved away from their original roots of entertainment. The best that I can say about it is that it is merely a laggy, ramped-up version of cops-and-robbers that we all played as little kids. If you are looking for a decent F2P game, I would advise you to look elsewhere.

												An interesting game. You could even call it a 'GTA MMORPG'. Positive: Many people play it It's Free Plenty of entertaining tasks to do plus free roam  You can play with friends in a group and/or form a clan  Massively in-depth customization of characters, vehicles and more! Large open worlds Has an Anti-CheatNegative: Demanding (Hardware wise) Certain things which may give a slight gameplay advantage are buyable with real money Slow loading time (On my PC which is below recommended but above minimal requirements) May seem like a grind May be difficult to learn at first The launching of the game (After the steam download) is very buggy You need to create an account to play Not the best community in the worldOverall, a great game. The negative list, while longer than the positive list, is overcome by the positives, and this free game is definitely worth a try.7/10

content:
Posted: February 9, 2014
												APB on the surface is an amazing game. Being able to play the role of a vigilate cop or a hardened criminal is enticing, and the fully customizable characters, cars, and tattoos are awesome features to boot. However, when you download the game and play it for a day or two, you quickly realize that the grandeour of what was promised is simply just not delivered...While true the custimization is a very developed feature, the actual gameplay is less than desirable. Essentially missions are the same across the board, either defend somthing, or attack and maybe shuttle a car or an object (cocaine, evidence, ect...) to a specified area. During that time, it's a slugfest between the players who have no sense of cooperation, or are just ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s in general. More on that later thoughThe guns in APB serve genaric roles, short, medium, or long range with the option of sidearms to compensate for weaknesses. The guns are generally ok, but the ones bought from the ARMA shop (paid with real cash) offer significant advantages to the vanilla guns, such as longer range, higher ammo capacity, and faster rate of fire. Now, the vanilla guns have the capacity to rival these weapons, but it takes an incredible amount of experience with the gun of your choice (SMG, Assualt Rifle ect...) to gain access to the mods that will alter the weapon.So it can be argued that this game isn't pay to win because the players who don't pay can EVENTUALLY rival the people who do pay, there is a very noticable difference in power, and you'll see it too. The weapon I most often see against me is the "Whisper" submachine gun varient. It is designed to hide muzzle flash and noise while also boosting range at a negligible difference in stopping power. This weapon is only available with real money, and while you can mod a submachine gun to get some benefit, the silencer is exclusive to the "Whisper". This gives a player an incredible advantage over other players who dont want to pay. This is just one example though, there are multiple weapons on the ARMA market that offer similar exclusive features not found anywhere in the vanilla game. It makes going against these players incredibly frustrating to go against, and unless you have significant skill and willpower, odds are they are going to kill you repeatedly.Besides unfair weapons, the playerbase in APB is terrible, and doing missions is nigh impossible, ESPECIALLY IF YOU ARE NEW. Players, who are on your team, will kill you if they feel you are a noob or are slowing them down, they either think its funny to pick on you, or they just are really that upset at you. They will just kick you in most cases (Somtimes after killing you) without a second thought. If you get into one of their precious modded vehicles (to get a ride to an objective for example), they will either leave and go spawn their car and leave without you, get out of their car and demand you leave, (surprise!) just kick you from the mission, or a combination of all three. While it can't be applied to all players, I've met a few people who were great to work with, the majority of the community are in cliques and can be quite mean to new players or lone wolves, and I've seen it happen. Somtimes it even gets to the point where it could be considered cyber bullying, and I'm not joking or exagerating about that.All in all, APB is a title that I wanted to be a good game. It just wasn't there though, and I feel now my time has been wasted. I suggest you avoid this game and spend your time and money elsewhere.Summary:-Gameplay gets boring and repetitive-Great division in power between F2P players and P2W players-Division in power between Free weapons and Pay weapons-Absolutely horrendous playerbase, rude, disrespectful, and uncooperative (Even Teamkilling for god's sake!)-Not even remotely friendly to new players

content:
Posted: March 28, 2014
												For the 1st and 2nd day this was a great game to play by myself and with friends. However over time this game started to slip away from the fun side. The game was full of tryhards, and I could see it was a pay to win because of this I started to feel less pumped about the game. I started to think "Am I back in call of duty?". However I continued playing the game as I liked large amounts of it and that I'm not one to just turn my back on a game due to some 'errors'. Then on the 3rd or 4th day (after being stressed out from everyday life) I logged in to have a whale of a time only to find a lovely message "account blocked/ error 10008". After looking online I found many people have got this due to so called 'cheating'. I have not cheated. So why am I blocked from this game! I'm not saying people don't cheat but People have been playing the game for thousands of hours and kicked due to just playing the damn game! Some people have just got the game and blocked before they had even started playing the game. Sounds fishy? I also have problems logging onto they're website and I feel like I have wasted 44 hours. 44 hours I'm not getting back! I feel sorry for the people who have spent hundreds of hours on this! So no, I don't recommend this game. Sorry APB Reloaded but never again will I play your games or recommend this game to anyone else. Thank you to anyone who spent there time to read this and thank you to the people who have made and helped keep this game running for the hours of fun I have had but I think I'm ganna stick to the games that care about they're players.   From your little friend MЄƠƜƓƠƊȤ

content:
Posted: September 24, 2014
												This is probably my favorite game of all time. I love this game for many reasons. One reason being that it has an EXTREMELY wide array of customization features. You can customize pretty much everything from weapons to clothes to cars to custom themes to play whenever you kill someone! Another reason this game is so amazing is because of the gameplay. It never gets boring or bland (especially when playing with friends!) It is also so much fun to pop out and shoot someone down that is about to score the last winning point to cause you to lose the mission. The game has awesome and  hilarious physics that will cause your car to literally FLY in the air whenever you hit a ramp! The game is overall very smooth, extremely fun, and very versatile and different. I like to think of it as if GTA and a Cops and Robbers style game had a baby. This game is fantastic.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 23, 2013
												This game has one of the best character creators I've seen in a while, especially for a free to play title.After I'd finished tweaking my characters' individual nostril hairs (exaggeration) I was ready to get started on the actual game and see what havoc I could get up to with my superbly shaped avatar.Turns out, not all that much. Once you get to the actual game there really isn't much of anything going on and the first impressions are utterly horrid. Even a task as trivial as equipping a new shirt that you get for a mission reward had me stumped and after a decent deal of frustration and tedium I simply gave up.Unintuitive, unbalanced and simply unfun.If you want to waste half an hour in a pretty good character creator though, there's worse you can do.

content:
Posted: April 22
												All round a decent concept, but on the other hand a complete and utter fail in pretty much everything. The super slow progression for new players makes it very hard for them to stand a chance or even enjoy the game. It is P2W, anyone that says otherwise has likely put a few grand into the game already. The ranking teir system that is suppose to help break up the newbies from the vets is trash and is easily broken so in the end it may as well not even be there. My biggest issue is grenades.. like seriously if you get hit by a grenade you're dead.. no if and or buts, but in this game players litterally can live 3 full blasts from them. As a vet player im sure you do enjoy the game, but this is not a game you come to as a new player if you want to enjoy yourself (unless you have a few hundred dollars laying around that you can blow). After that being said it really has a feel that the devs have not played the game in years and couldnt give a sh!t because the vets that do play spend more than enough for them.

Vehicles can be customized in many different ways... you can change body parts or engine sound, add turbo, add police lights (if you are Enforcer), or you can repaint parts of your vehicle and add stickers-(you can win stickers, buy them or create!) There is a lot of things to do.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												I wish I could describe this game in just one or two paragraphs but it wouldn't do it justice. Ever wanted to play "Cops N Robbers" in a big city in real-life, complete with real-life weapons and cars but can't? Then APB: Reloaded is the game for you. In the virtual world of San Paro, you can wield weapons , drive cars and engage in drive-bys, shoot-outs and various other law-enforcement or law-breaking activities depending on the side you choose.This game has a huge variety of weapons like the Joker CR-5 assault rifle (in-game version of the M16), OCA-EW Submachine Gun (MP5), SHAW 556 LMG (MG4) as well as a good many choices for cars. It features bulky and tanky SUVs like the Nulander Pioneer (in-game version of the Chevrolet Tahoe) to speed demons such as the Patriot V20 Jericho (Shelby Mustang GT).Don't get me started on the customisation level. It is truly out of this world. Symbols, decals, clothings - you got to see it for yourself to believe.Create a character. Choose a side, choose a weapon, choose which piece of clothing to customise, choose a symbol, choose to make your own symbol, choose your outfit, choose your alter-ego and...choose to have fun by playing APB.Choose to...be all that you can't be.

If you enjoy grinding consistently for months/years and forking out Hundreds to Thousands of dollars a year for a premium membership and/or Pay2Win weapons, then this game was made specifically for YOU.If you enjoy a fun time without having to deal with absurd gunplay, lag, wonkey driving, hackers, pay2wins, and the worst gaming community of all time, then stay farrrr away from this game.  THE COMMUNITY IS ONE OF THE WORST I'VE EVER SEEN,  worse than LoL's. If you DO want to play this game, hide the chat. As it is constantly popping up with stupid kids and childish adults yelling at each other / falsely accusing someone of hacking / or just complaining about the game they are playing. It truely is sad, this game has the best customization in a game  EVER.  But it is wasted on a cash grab like this game. GamersFirst is one of the worst companies of all time, worse than EA. Basically, what the did was this: They resurected this game, which was originally created by another company. Since then, they have done jack sh*t to the game, all new content has been added in the form of paid content. They receive a**loads of money from premium members, yet they can't even keep their servers going. This company took a great game (which caused the sad end to an original and innovative company) and turned it into nothing but a cancerous money grab.Screw professionalism. Do not give your money to this piece of sh*t game, it's f**ing terrible, and it can be like cigarettes to some people once you get too far into it, luckily I got out. Go play a decent and balanced Free to Play, like Team Fortress 2, Planetside 2, or even Blacklight: Retribution. Stay away from this piece of sh*t, and don't let the awesome customization fool you into giving it a chance, it's better to just ignore it and spend your time on a game that actually deserves it.  Pros Awesome customization (character and vehicle)Great driving (can be a bit wonky at first, but once you get the hang of it nothing beats drifting around huge corners in the vegas)Great asthetic styleOriginal ideaChallengingRequires TeamworkIntegrated Clans and GroupsBuilt in Music player which allows you to broadcast your own songs to other playersBuilt in Audio Workstation to create your own short theme(s) that play to other players after you've killed them. (If you produce music like I do you will have some fun with this one) Built in market for players to sell clothing, cars, weapons, themes and other in-game items.Two Fun and Fairly Large MapsSharp on-foot controlsGunplay focuses more on gun stats, range, and how many hits were landed, damage is not locationalNo bullsh** gun-play, shots will hit where your crosshair lands, but their is recoil / shot spread Cons Most of the new/cool content you have to pay real money forLaggy serversHackersTotal GrindOverpriced Premium Membership and paid itemsAbsolutely HORRID communityNon-locational damageSome Pay2win WeaponsHigh level players have an obvious advantage over lower levels, so you have to rely on the matchmaking to pair you against a team of similar levels, which it doesn't. Some features available for free in the past were cut and put back in as paid content (Vehicle Body Kits)Everyone in the social district seems like they're in a coma, everyone just stands around completely still and silent Player-bought/won billboards in social district almost ALWAYS has at least one containing nudity and or hentaiSome absolutely awful missions. For example, in a VIP Mission, the VIP player can get in a car, BUT the car will have something like a 50% speed reduction, but it doesn't matter, because it may take a while, but the car will eventually get up to full speed. So, if VIP gets into a car like the Vegas (fastest car in the game) they can get up to full speed and leave the opposition unable to catch up, even if they enter a vehicle of equal speed, as long as the VIP stays at a steady pace they will continue on at the same speed, so the VIP will gain ground at the same speed the Opp will gain on them, running out the clock and granting a win the cheap, ♥♥♥♥♥-tactic VIP. Ghosting / Ghosters. For example if you are chasing a VIP in the scenario above you will likely get rammed into a wall / corner by some random♥♥♥♥♥♥who isn't even involved in your mission. Ghosting is usually due to players wanting to take out their aggression caused by the piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥game they are currently playing, so instead of beating off or screaming into a pillow or punching a wall or breaking things like normal people usually do to releive stress, these toxic children will usually ruin someone elses game experience instead. Hell, they don't even have to be specifically ghosters either, ♥♥♥♥ing with people in this game is so easy when in a car people will even do it while on their way to / on a mission themselves. And yes, if you haven't played this game, people who aren't in your mission can still hit, ram, and push your car, damage isn't done to either car but if pushed into a wall at a high enough speed the victim's car will take damage from the wall or even explode regardless. Dump TrucksDon't play this game.

content:
Posted: January 16, 2012
												Nice game and pretty fun to play for a while, but just as any f2p,the game does have some serious issues. In the case of apb,it's the balancing of the 2 factions,enforcers and criminals (=pigs and crims). While criminals are really fun to play,enforcers get a huge advantage over them by being able to "witness them" and pretty much 2shot them (the combat mechanics of the game are: hold down your mousebutton,the one with the better weapon or first hit will win.) The problem here is that the notoriety system of the game lets the pigs witness any criminal with a high enough rating. This gives cops a huge combat advantage,since you can't shoot cops as crim unless they witness you and start shooting. If you dont mind balancing and serious hacker issues,you'll have a fun time,especially when playing with some mates.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: August 19, 2014
												After sinking alot of hours and money into this game I think I can review it. When I first started playing around 3 years ago it was great and I instantly fell in love with it, I spent money on G1C and made cars, clothing and bought guns and had fun designing different personas and because the customization is amazing you could make Miley Cyrus, make a tour van, get guns to suit her, make your theme when you kill someone her song and make your tour van blast out an entire song of hers. Or you could just make ♥♥♥♥♥ and hentai like 80% of people do there. The game in that sense is amazing but when it comes to combat it is still fun for the most part but has horrible matchmaking, hitboxes, ranking system. Lets say you are a Trainiee (The lowest rank and level 9) and you press K to ready up in a mission you will most likely get put against a Gold level 205 who has no fall damage, kevlar, fast car and a rocket launcher and that completely ruins the experience and they've even added a district with NO matchmaking so whoever presses K to enter a mission gets put with anyone and to me that seems like a cheap way to add stuff to the game without trying to fix anything and lets say you were to pull up next to your friend and run over his toe at 2mph he will die... INSTANTLY and that just makes the whole combat feel slow, broken and horrible.There are three sets of money in this game, dollars, Joker Tickets and G1C, dollars are earned by selling on the ingame markey place, so cars and symbols, songs and themes and are earned by doing missions, killing people on bounty and such, its grindy to earn as a cop and ok to earn as a criminal as you can simply steal from stores on a low populated district and earn around 100k in a couple of hours but it gets broken by the fact that premium members who pay for membership get more money per mission and such and so the person whos talented at designing songs or symbols or who has the money to buy premium gets richer faster. Joker tickets are earned by completeling a set of objectives in Fight Club districts where its basically team deathmatch and you will get notifications like "Kill 5 people with granades" and you will get another after that and then you can earn Joker Tickets. These can be spent on getting temporary perks like car surfer to ride on cars or normally expensive weapons and cars, the next currency in the game is G1C this is real money in the Gamers First market place and its where the pay to win comes into play. You can either be like me and spend £350+ in the game and get 3 legendary weapons, alot and alot of cars, premium and symbols and stuff, or you can get lucky and buy a box for £4 and then get a legendary weapon worth millions in game but this marketplace is horrid, its all pay to win weapons and really makes the game not very fun to play when against someone with weapons from the store. Customer Service from Gamers First is also horrible, I got banned about 2 years ago, maybe a year and a half ago for no reason, they said that I used an aimbot and such but i've never even downloaded one and after spending about £200 in the game at this point I was annoyed, I contacted them and explained my situation and even offered them to scan my PC using teamviewer or screenshots of my APB folders and game but they all said every time 'Theres nothing we can do, you are banned forever' and I gave up on the game and forgot about it for a month and tried to login and I was unbanned, so its very strange and I still dont have an explination for the ban to this day. Customer service hardly respond quickly and they always respond with an automated response, no real human so thats a massive dissapointment.The missions consist of 'Capture this, deliver this, break this, steal this, deliver this, do this, go here' and you can do ALL of that, literally do ALL of that and then if your opposition has the better shot or gun you will lose the mission because at the end of EVERY mission it all comes down to who has the better car or gun. As a criminal you will most of the time be breaking into winwos and setting doors on fire to steal hard drives and deliver them, you can do ALL 5 set of missions before the end deathmatch and still lose the mission but if you are an enforcer and you stop the cirminal delivering the first hard drive congrats. You win. The missions you can for the most part live with but after a while they start repeating and get quickly boring so you'll find yourself in the Fight Club districts or the Asylum in team deathmatch just to spice things up or you'll find yourself in the very fun new dynamic missions that are present in the regular districts where they resemble the most recent Christmas event where you find a granade launcher and you need to kill 15 other players who try to kill you before delivering it to a contact, the granade launcher gives you buffed health and a buffed launcher.Overall this game is very fun at parts but very very annoying at times so if you can put up with the Pay to win, the small amount of hackers, the bad combat, the boring missions and the horrible customer support to play a game that resembles a bad GTA with AMAZING customization then this game is great. I can put up with it so I love it, its my favorite game of all time so far and it still is even though it has its flaws and faults I love it and theres rumors going around that G1C are making a new game engine with updated graphics, physics and such so maybe, just maybe if its true and released before this game dies it will change the entire game for the better.TL;DR: A very buggy game with awful combat, pay to win players, customer support, matchmaking, updates but its worth it if you like customization and want a game where you can make a million personas with cars, songs, symbols and clothes and if you can put up with the bad things you will fall in love with this game.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2014
												This game is a lot of fun. If you like Grand Theft Auto but want a straight PvP experience, this is for you. There are NPCs who give you missions, but the missions are all PvP. It's still fun to play alone when I have some time to kill, but it's a far better experience if you can partner up with at least one other person to help coordinate against your opposition. A wide variety of mission objectives keeps things very interesting. It's rarely a situation of "kill all the cops before they kill you." Jacking cars, tagging walls, hacking satellite dishes, stealing people's organs for sale on the black market, bounties on high threat players, bombing buildings, mugging people, stealing and destroying evidence before it can get into a court, street racing, raiding electronics and jewelry stores, fencing the stolen goods, laundering money...it's crazy how much trouble you can cause!Customization is awesome. You can apply custom graphics all over your car, your clothes, your body. People who don't like the in-game clothing options will often tattoo their own clothing designs right onto their characters' bodies. It makes for a really deep customization experience, and you'll regularly be turning your head to get a closer look at what cool customization someone else has come up with. It is amazing.I have one complaint. This game is most definitely "pay-to-win." $40 of G1C (cash shop currency) gets you an amazing gun with amazing mods that eats through all other players easily. So if you usually spend $40 on a game you'll play for a couple hundred hours, go for that since you otherwise don't need to spend any money to play this game. People who spend money will often beat you no matter how skilled you become. The cash shop has cheaper pay-to-win guns, but they expire after X number of days. The guns you buy with in-game money all expire after 10 days. Fortunately there's not much else to do with all the in-game money you accumulate so it doesn't really hurt.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2014
APB Reloaded - Siuya's ReviewI was scrolling through some Steam reviews and just had to say, they were all terrible so I decided to write one of my own. If you have something to add or would like to see something changed, leave a comment.What is APB Reloaded about?<source:http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/APB:_All_Points_Bulletin>The game takes place in the modern-day city of San Paro where there is a constant battle between Enforcers and Criminals, and the player will need to decide to which faction they want to belong.Gameplay typically consists of the two sides fighting one another in missions, where one side must complete a series of objectives with the other side attempting to stop them doing so. For example, several Criminal players may rob a convenience store within the game; the game will then seek out one or more Enforcer players of equivalent skills and other criteria and will issue an all-points bulletin for them to stop the robbery and apprehend or eliminate the Criminals. Players earn money for participating in these missions, which can then be used to upgrade weapons, vehicles, and their character appearances, all of which influence the game.The game is played in the third person perspective. Upgrades, equipment, weapons, vehicles and clothing can be purchased from various contacts around the city (or can be alternatively bought through terminals in the social district), while ammunition is bought from vending machine-like terminals. Both the contacts and the "vending machines" are scattered throughout the main three districts of the city. Two of the districts feature their own fully persistent portions of San Paro, with their own pedestrian AI and a dynamic day/night cycle, along with certain contacts and missions. The third district acts mainly as a social component, being much smaller, having no pedestrians, restricting weapon and vehicle access, and featuring garages, auction houses, music studios, and several other NPC terminal shops. While in the third district, players, even if they're from opposing factions, cannot harm each other and may only interact through chat. In the other two districts, players are allowed to attack each other (so long as they are from opposing factions) during certain mission scenarios and/or if a player has a bounty on his head. When outside of these missions players can still draw and use weapons, but bullets, grenades, etc. will not work on other players, even those from an enemy faction. This prevents deathmatching and griefing.There are also two other districts under the category of "fight club." These feature pure PvP environments for more experienced players and clans.Why would you want to play this game?APB will provide you with many laughs and cries of frustration. What really stands out is the amount of possible customization in this game. If you have the mind of an artist you'll simply be amazed with the personalization of your character and vehicles. The graphics are still beautiful and the mechanics are quite enjoyable.If you're only going for the combat, this might not be the game for you. There could be a few things that will be bothering you. The hit registration is a bit wonky and sometimes the game is terrible with lag. The matchmaking isn't that great, because there is a huge difference in skill. Either way it will be a challenging match for someone and it's definitely recommended to play with a team and communicate on Teamspeak.It takes effort and time to become a great player in this game, but having a decent computer will grant you some advantage already. It's a rough learning curve and the community will not go easy on you. Incapable players will insult you and skilled players will mock you a lot. The key to survive in this game is to find decent people that will fit your personality so you may forget about all that. Once you're familiar with APB Reloaded, you will learn to love it and it's going to be difficult to find another game that will meet your expectations. The game is unique and still has so much potential to grow, the staff is still working to improve the game with an upcoming engine upgrade "Soon™" to create even more possibilities, which will eventually and finally get rid of the limited game performance.APB is a free2play game, but is this game pay2win?No! Let me start with taking away the illusion of the pay2win aspect. APB is a free2play game and gives you a slightly "limited" version if you're not willing to upgrade your account with "Premium". So what is this Premium Membership actually giving you?Originally posted by APBRwiki:A Premium Membership for APB can be bought through the Armas Marketplace, and sometimes can be received free through some Redeem Codes, and gives players several advantages in the field.Premium BenefitsUp to a 90% bonus to all Contact Standing (XP) Gains.125% bonus to all APB$ gains.20% discount in the Armas Marketplace.50% reduced cooldown on activated abilities (e.g., Field Supplier, Nitro Booster).Advanced access to Customization Suites (50 Symbols per Vehicle / Clothing item. 100 layers per Symbol).Extended duration for Armas Trials for Weapon and Vehicle Trials.Basically it means you rank up some faster and get some more APB$ while playing. The advanced customization is the only aspect you will be missing without Premium. So if you're a great designer, I'd definitely recommend upgrading to Premium.The rest of the Armas Marketplace offers weapons, vehicles/kits and clothing. These available so called "pay2win" weapons are merely re-skins and have the same statistics as already existing in-game weapons. Some might have slightly different statistics, but can still easily be beaten by the standard weapons. Also some of these Armas weapons, vehicles and kits are also available at the in-game Joker Store for a period of time by the use of Joker Tickets earned in Fight Club or with Daily Activities. If anything this game is "pay4looks". More information on weapon statistics etc. can be found here: APB Database[apbdb.com]What's up with all the cheaters?Another illusion this game offers is the amount of cheaters. It's really not as bad as they say it is in other reviews. Since FairFight was introduced a lot of cheaters have been out of luck. Besides that, there is the very high learning curve and some experienced players might seem to cheat when they aren't. Most of the experienced players are even able to outsmart a cheater by using the environment to his/her advantage. There might occasionally be a blatant cheater every now and then, but they'll be gone soon enough thanks to FairFight or an in-game moderator, which we could use some more in my opinion.Room for improvement, might be a little exaggerated, but it's noticeable:Server Merge + Overkill Servers | Low population, bad server performance.Engine Upgrade | Bad system performance for older computers and laptops.In-Game Moderation | Lack of supervision, activity of GMs.Matchmaking + Threat | Still unbalanced, large gap between silver and gold threat.User Interface + Scaleform | Slow interaction, limited functionality.Trading System | The marketplace is not an easy A to B trade, no cash transfer.Mailbox | Mission reward spam, limited attachment options.New content | Contacts, hairstyles, modifications, clothing, vehicles, game-modes.

number of helpful: 7 of 11 people (64%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 19, 2015
												This game has always been a guilty pleasure of mine, however, that alone cannot save it.Although the premise of this game is great, and the customization is extremely in-depth, it simply has too many flaws to make it a good game.  The cash shop, or the "Armas Marketplace" as it is known ingame, completely ruins any and all balance by releasing ridiculously overpowered weapons.  *cough* VAS C2 Troublemaker *cough* The weapon mechanics in APB are EXTREMELY broken.  Players using certain submachine guns can snipe players at long distance with ease.  Also, there are no scopes worth mentioning on sniper rifles, which makes them worthless beyond 100 metres or so.  This lack of sniping mechanics is further confounded with the lack of a head hitbox.  This leads to, you guessed it, NO HEADSHOTS!  This creates even less of a reason to use weapons besides submachine guns, because where you shoot makes no ABSOLUTELY no difference!  Not to mention, the time to kill in this game is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly low, you CAN and WILL die in a fraction of a second when a player pops around the corner using a VAS C2.   Now that we've talked about the gameplay, we can talk about the community.  APB's community is one of the most horrific, hate filled communities I have ever been a part of.  Any time I log onto a district, the chat is filled with players endlessly cursing one another out and accusing players of hacking.  Which brings me to my next point.  Hackers are extremely prevalent in this game, and despite the presence of an "anticheat" used by Reloaded Productions, it does next to nothing to dam the endless river of hackers flowing into this game.   When you're not playing against hackers, APB's horrendous matchmaker will be SURE to match you against players three times your level, armed to the teeth with weapons and armored cars.  This shouldn't be a problem, due to the so called "x threat level" servers.  The gold players are supposed to play on the gold servers, the silvers on the silver server, and so on.  This however, does not happen.  Gold players intentionally drop down to silver or bronze threat level, which allows them to run rampant on bronze servers and completely annhiliate the fresh new players, just leaving the tutorial.  In conclusion, I URGE you to avoid this piece of crap game, unless you're looking for a funny way to waste time, or have a fetish for bad games.

number of helpful: 11 of 19 people (58%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 3
												Alright, so first things first, some background about myself playing this game.I've been playing this game for about 4 years now, and it has been a blast, honestly. The amount of fun i've had in this game is overwhelming. I gotta say, from the moment i saw it on youtube i had to play it. It wasn't an easy task to say since this game is one of the hardest to play but one of the most enjoyable ones, you will find all kinds of skill types in here, from casual people that just like having a little time off reality to actual tryhards who would put you down in matter of seconds, so if you want to be good, stay in line, there are many more people trying their best too. As i said it's not an easy game, the learning curve here is really steep at the top. It took me about 400 hours of gold gameplay to get the hang of it, and even now after 2000 and even more to come i haven't even got to the top of this great game.Now on to the review:Pros of playing APB:-Incredible level of customization, customize your car, your character and your symbols with a level of detail many five star games would even like to approach, share it with the world.-Best third person gameplay i've ever tested, combat is fluid, fast and frenetic. With a vast amount of roles and weapons that only put more into it.-A wide amount of mission variety that improves the expierence cops vs crim style.-Satisfying PvP (When you are winning obviously, no game is fun losing).-A multicultural community varying from over 20 countries JUST in the European server, besides Japaneese and Na servers.-In-game music studio, to create your own custom theme songs. -Seasonal events.-Bung plays it.Cons of playing APB:-Not enough content release due to engine problems. (Which are being fixed atm)-Somewhat toxic community (Tons of memes included in the package).-Settings are not that changeable with the preset game.-Not a good game performance due to broken UE8.-Hackers are wildly seen around the game, try to ignore them.Despite the pros and cons is a game that i absolutely love and would want to play everyday seeing it grow again back to it's former glory and even further.GavidaR-2100 Hours of gameplay as of 03/01/2017

content:
Posted: December 27, 2011
												I downloaded this badboy with extreme reluctance (just cannae resist these free to play games :D) and it turned out to be much much better than I thought, the customisation (my main draw to most of these games) is probably the best ive ever seen (think brink but with the ability to design and apply decals of your own design and a lot more permutations of apparel). The basic gameplay is good ,solid, thirdperson shooter action ~ the missions remain varied each with multiple stages; each stage being a different gametype (capture the flag, domination, vip team deathmatch, etc). Getting to each mission involves similar mechanics to GTA and other city-roam games, just jack some poor fools car :D or take your own customised car/truck/van available from spawn points dotted across the map and take your team with you (the most fun ive had in a long time ;p) :DThe microtransactions within the game are non-compulsory and can be ignored, since you can earn ingame money and get them that way :D

content:
Posted: January 24
												This game has a great concept, customisation system, and variety, however, unfortunatly, very poorly executed, in a nutshell, it's a Pay 2 Win GTA-Style MMO that had great potential, but it went down the drain, it's a very fun game for the first few hours you play it, but as the missions spiral on, you start to see the problems seep in through the cracks...1. As a free player myself, i've noticed it's extremely hard to get anything you want that is upper-class without upgrading to a premium account or using real money.2. The whole "Cops vs Criminals" thing is broken, the Enforcers cannot make any worthwhile cash if the Criminals don't ready up for a mission, and because of this, there are some desperate Enforcers i've encountered that have begged the Criminals to ready up on low-pop areas, and most of the time nothing will happen, and they get to the point where they actively try to instigate a mission by following you and waiting for you to do something they can use as a means to dispatch against you, and the Criminals are usually grinding for something expensive, as to why they aren't wanting to go on a mission, so if you don't notice one, you'll lose all your money and progress from that 40 minutes of grinding if they kill you. And the Criminals can't do anything about it3. Another point on Paragragh one, the P2W aspect is a catastrophic problem in matchmaking, even on high-pop areas, the game doesen't effectively balance matches even in mission areas, where it's sorted via skill compatability, not availability, and yet my friends and I (Bronze to Silver threat levels) get frequently put up against Gold-Tier Enforcers, who are either Wallet Warriors, or people who sweat so hard over the game it's not fun.Also it's kind of ironic seeing that the company who made a Pay-2-Win game is called "GamersFirst".More Like MoneyFirst.4.5/10.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 26, 2016
												The game of great promises, greater disappointment and epic development fail. The game that's supposed to be every little boy's cops-n-robbers dream come true. However because of poor managment not only did it sink the company behind it, but even under the wings of a new owner people connected with the development process, being it developers or community managers, either got fired a few times or quit on their own.The game is extremly newbie unfriendly, the weapon/shooting/engagement mechanics are so weird that the experience gained in other FPS/TPS games doesn't carry well into this one. There's a tutorial (finally, after being worked on for about 1,5 year or so), but it doesn't teach you anything that will help you to survive against hardened old timers of San Paro, because let's face it - the only people left still playing this game are the ever so bitter die-hards, that are so addicted, they won't let go. Be advised, you'll be facing them often, and when you do, they'll pull every dirty trick in the book, do anything and everything in their power to make your stay in San Paro as miserable and frustrating as they are.So is this game this bad? That's a trick question. There's this really nice matchmaker feature that should match you up against people of simmilar skill level. It should, but currently the population pool is so low that the matchmaker has some real proplems finding the right people, so don't be surprised if a lot, if not most, of your missions are extremely one-sided. And most often you'll be on the wrong side.APB is also the only game I ever played in which just driving around the map during the mission and♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥off your opponents can be way more fun than actually playing the game like it was meant.It's also the only game that ups its hardware requirements bit by bit with each patch. I remember the times when I could record the game in 60FPS, 800x500, while running the game in 60FPS HD with highest detail settings and antialiasing. I don't know what went wrong, but the last time I ran it, I could barely get 45FPS on medium settings.The greatest power of this game is that it's one of a kind, there's really no other like it. All the shooting and driving, and shooting while driving, car chases, skirmishes, sudden twists... all of this is great fun... until you get screwed either by being matched against a group of four teamspeaking clannies that will♥♥♥♥♥♥you silly, or just the game itself, like:• being spawned 150m from the objective while the opposing team spawns right next to it,• being spawned in some sh!thole where the civilization suddenly died and noone owned a car, with the closest car spawner farther than the objective itself,• the objective spawning in a place thats nearly impossible to storm when properly defended, ofcourse with the enemy already guarding it• general respawn mechanics - missions get won or lost because of it.• weird camera workings, which results in your toon often obstructing whatever you're aiming at,• bugs that remain unfixed to this day,• so you just switched to your sniper rifle? Nice, but now the fight moved to a close quartes area, take your precious mission time and switch again; you did? Great, but we could use a sniper now...... I could go on like this. There are just so many gameflow breaking faults of random annoyance that at some point you're so fed up with the game that you quit... only to go back two weeks later to have a lot of fun and then suddenly being reminded what♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥you so much in this game, and you quit again... this love-hate relationship may go on for a while, but at some point you grow the maturity to finally quit, uninstall and never look back.Currently the game dies little by little with the population systematically shrinking each month. There's a (supposedly) big update coming up (that's been delayed 2 years already) which will replace the dated, old, heavily customized Unread Engine with a "factory issue" Unreal 3 engine (if I remember correctly). A lot of people bound great hopes with this event, however, as devs stated, the new engine will bring a bit better graphics and will allow to bring more content to the game a lot easier and faster. By more content I understand probably more guns, cars and clothing which will be sold thru ARMAS - the ingame cash shop. IMHO APB doesn't need more content, as it won't fix the game's fundamental issues, frustrating gameflow breakers and dangling pieces of gameplay mechanics that Real Time Worlds never managed to properly implement.Update: G1 rolled an event that was actually worth playing so I decided to reinstall. After three hours I can clearly tell that the cheating is out of hand. Each mission in which I participated had at least one gold-threat low-rating player (which indicates a freshly created account) in both teams, running around in newbie clothes kicking everyone's♥♥♥♥♥sky high. Go figure. Plus, old bugs, like the scoreboard bug (players from previous missions in current mission scoreboard, so you can't tell who're you up against) still not fixed. There's just absolutely no fun left in this game what so ever. No engine update is gonna save this burning trainwreck.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2014
												Personally, I really like this game, and have devoted quite a while into it. The patches and all do move along at a somewhat slow rate, given the small dev team, but I think its actually a really good game. I read some of the other reviews and I will address some of the issues mentioned.Pay2Win-Basically every gun in the ARMAS Marketplace is a reskin of a gun you get from in-game progression, and the few execeptions have lots of downsides to balance their upsides. Anyone who claims that guns are p2w most likely hasn't gone to the cash shop and trialed the guns, which by the way, you can do, trialing all of the guns for 30minutes/3hours depending if you have premium membership. Really though, the in-game progression weapons are on par, or even better than their cash shop counterparts.Hackers- This community is so paranoid of hackers, its pretty much a given that either one person might seem like they are hacking, or you will get hackusated. Just realize that its possible that people are better than you, because some people have been around 4-5 years, since the start in RTW times.Lag-At the time of this post, one of the districts, Waterfront, has been rather laggy, but they have been working on a fix for it, and the lag only occurs when there are more than 60 people per instance (excess people can move to a different instance to fight the lag, but sometimes they just don't)Okay, and one more thing, its not as if you are paying $60 + DLC galore, its a free game. I understand this game might not be for everyone, mainly people that can't accept that people are better than them, and resort to calling people hackers or calling weapons p2w. Give it a shot, though, because it truly is pretty good quality for a f2p game.

content:
Posted: January 14, 2012
												Spend 90% of the time customising your character and 10% of the time getting shot10/10-------------------On a serious note,There are a lot of bad reviews for this game... if you are looking for a casual shooter game, this is NOT the game for you. Combat takes a suprising amount of skill, and this game is NOT noob friendly. It's very likely you'll lose your first few matches, very, very badly. What this game is, is a great game to play with a few friends, with some of the best character / vehicle / music customisation of any game I've played in a while.The editors in this game are amazing, and there's no end to the level of creativity you find with what people make with the designers. The music studio is particularly good, and I'm a huge fan of it. I've found that with a bit of work, it's possible to create a HUGE variety of songs and music, and if that's something you enjoy, I would very highly recommend this game.The gameplay is actually pretty good once you get the hang of combat. Matchmaking is not always the best, and sometimes it takes a bit of time to actually find a mission, but they tend to be good fun.Vehicles in the game are quite hard to handle in some cases, which I see as a challenge, and a nice way to seperate those who are good at driving and those who aren't (I think I fall into the second catagory xD). There's also a nice variety, although it takes a lot of time to actually unlock any sort of body customization options for cars, and people who care a lot about that sort of thing might be forced into buying body kits with real money...Character customisation, now that I get to it, it very thorough, and allows you to have a pretty good go at making whatever character you can think of. Designing outfits works really well, and is by far one of the best systems in the game other than the music editor.-------------------Long review over, I'd recommend trying this game... so far I've played w̶i̶t̶h̶o̶u̶t̶ ̶s̶p̶e̶n̶d̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶a̶n̶y̶ ̶m̶o̶n̶e̶y̶ (I've bought a̶ ̶f̶e̶w̶  far too many items from the store, although these are not really necessary to enjoy the game at all, in fact a few of my friends have spent nothing), if you're a bit of a car customisation fan, you may find yourself spending a bit, other than that, the game can be enjoyed a lot for free!If you haven't tried this game yet, give it a go, you might be surprised :)

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 15, 2016
												I used to be a sucker for this game. I just came back to gaming, and this will be the first game that I'll come back to.Reasons why:Deep customization systemThis game has the deepest customization system that I've seen in any games so far. When it comes to terms of vehicles and clothing, it outranks Sims.On vehicles, you can change your antennas, bumpers, wheels, tires, side-skirts, hoods, you can add custom registration plates, you can add custom decals, and paint your vehicle in a thousand different ways.Police vehicles have a variety of siren models, colors, and audio.Not to mention that there is a plenty of vehicles.On your characters, you can add tattoos, makeup, pubic hair, skin scars, birthmarks, your body build, your weight, your age, lots of face details, dozens of hair, facial hair, and body hair to choose from.There is lots of different clothing items; badges, necklaces, earings, piercings, t-shirts, shirts, cargo pants, jeans, skinny pants, sweatpants... Not to mention that you can add custom decals to your clothes, and paint♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ suspenders, arm patches, emblems, buttons, nametags, etc.You even have an in-game music editor, in which you can make your short "signature" song.It also has a really big collection of nice songs in the in-game radio, and you can also add your own music to your music player.I haven't played in a while, so I can't think of more at the moment, but I know that there are a LOT more customization features than what I've mentioned.  I wish it had houses.   This would be awesome, imagine all the Sims fans coming to the game, haha.Paid contentSince I started playing I kept hearing new/unskilled players moaning about "pay 2 win". There is no pay to win in the game. You can pay, yes. But paying only gives you less customization limits, and it gives you some weapons that every player can obtain through a bit of grinding, except that you get some paintjobs, too.MissionsMissions usually don't take more than 20-30 minutes, and can sometimes be as short as 5 minutes, which is great if you just want a game to play after a long day. WeaponsAgain, if you just want a game to play after a long day, then this is for you. You can spent hundreds of hours grinding the game to get the finest weaponry in all of  Skyrim  San Paro, but you can perform just fine in the tracksuit, SCAR and that small electric-looking car that you get during the training once you learn how to use it.Investing any money (real or not) is not essential.Getting new weapons won't make you stronger, it only gives you the opportunity to use what suits you best.CommunityYes, there are prepubescent players screaming that you are a hacker, but luckily, there is no global chat, so you won't have to buy a new headset every week.There is plenty of people that you can just chill with in the social district, play hide and seek, ♥♥♥♥ around with animations (there are plenty of animations!), race, drive around...MarketIf you're not really a battle-born type of a person, you can just stick to the social district and make uniforms, cars, designer shoes, songs, or whatever for people, and get paid well for it.You can also be a smuggler, unlock higher-level items, and then sell them for more to lower-lever players.Keep in mind that if you wish to be a designer it will require some initial grinding to unlock clothing parts, decals, etc. TL;DR	 Ignore the bad comments. The game is free, the game doesn't require you to pay real money to win. It doesn't require you to pay in-game money to win. Install it and have fun on your own way (and there are many ways!).

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												I spent ages playing this game on several different characters. It was fun, but after the security updates these people created, everything went wrong. You try to message the "support" and nobody replies for ~15 days. I got banned for doing absolutely nothing, and when I tried to get my account back, I was told my account was found using "malicious files". Nobody had access to my account, I was getting banned for either being too good at times in the game (where people would report me for hacking when I wasn't) and the staff couldn't take a second to check my account and my files to see if I was actually doing anything. This community is filled with greedy people trying to get money from people and once they notice that certain people stop purchasing their G1 cash for a pay-to-win game, they stop caring about them. But hey, maybe you like this game. It became boring and repetitive anyway. Take it from someone who spent ~200 hours on the game on this account, it's not worth it. I've spent at least $150 on the game (and was gifted another $200, because my friends saw how I enjoyed this game), and in the end even after all the game time everything began to go downhill. The community, the staff, and the increased pay-to-win. Good luck if you still play, and try not to get banned for doing absolutely nothing wrong.Edit 8/4/16:I figured I would come back and see if anything was changed, and I wasn't as 'rusty' as I thought I would be. So I went and played around a bit for literally ~9 hours and got banned this morning. I contacted support requesting a refund for even the cheapest skateboard back accessory cause I am not dealing with anymore of this games bs.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 20, 2013
												Amazing level of character customization. pay2win? no.. its not. Let me start with taking away the illusion of the pay2win aspect. APB is a free2play game and gives you a slightly "limited" version if you're not willing to upgrade your account with "Premium". So what is this Premium Membership actually giving you?A Premium Membership for APB can be bought through the Armas Marketplace, and sometimes can be received free through Redeem Codes and joker boxes, this gives players several advantages in the field. Premium BenefitsUp to a 90% bonus to all Contact Standing (XP) Gains.125% bonus to all APB$ gains.20% discount in the Armas Marketplace.50% reduced cooldown on activated abilities (e.g., Field Supplier, Nitro Booster).Advanced access to Customization Suites (50 Symbols per Vehicle / Clothing item. 100 layers per Symbol).Extended duration for Armas Trials for Weapon and Vehicle Trials.The rest of the Armas Marketplace offers weapons, vehicles/kits and clothing. These available so called "pay2win" weapons are merely re-skins and have the same statistics as already existing in-game weapons. Some might have slightly different statistics, but can still easily be beaten by the standard weapons. Also some of these Armas weapons, vehicles and kits are also available at the in-game Joker Store for a period of time by the use of Joker Tickets earned in Fight Club or with Daily Activities. If anything this game is "pay2pretty". ALL weapons ingame are available either in the joker store for JT, on the player market APB$, or on ARMAS for free trial.-partial credit to Siuya and G1/RP for armas info-

content:
Posted: December 29, 2011
												Now I know my hours of gameplay for this game doesn't say much, but hear me out anyways.APB:R is an open world MMO where the players could either be the criminals or the enforcers. The roles are quite self-explainatory The gameplay itself is quite what you would expect from any other third-person game, run to cover, peep out, unload your guns, that or you could just jump out and spray your munition and pray that it lands on the target. The gameplay however isn't what fascinates me, it is the customization option that you apply to your ride or your player model. You can create your very own designs from scratch, whether or not it ends up as tattoo or a car decal, the endless possiblity of creation is simply just mind blowing (Provided that you unlock all the customization option). As someone who studies graphic designs, this is my nice cup of tea. Note: Premium players can put in more customization items on their clothings/car/tattoos compared to f2p players.Of course, since this is a free to play game there are in-game items that you can buy to give you an edge against your opposition. Personally however, I think this game is still reasonable even if you are a f2p player.The only downside for me is probaly the community inside the game. I'm not sure about the other servers, but the server I'm currently residing in is just..just....  full of twelve years old who are uncapable of listening to reason and logic. Oh yeah. Also expect ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. Lots and lots of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.

												I used to be a sucker for this game. I just came back to gaming, and this will be the first game that I'll come back to.Reasons why:Deep customization systemThis game has the deepest customization system that I've seen in any games so far. When it comes to terms of vehicles and clothing, it outranks Sims.On vehicles, you can change your antennas, bumpers, wheels, tires, side-skirts, hoods, you can add custom registration plates, you can add custom decals, and paint your vehicle in a thousand different ways.Police vehicles have a variety of siren models, colors, and audio.Not to mention that there is a plenty of vehicles.On your characters, you can add tattoos, makeup, pubic hair, skin scars, birthmarks, your body build, your weight, your age, lots of face details, dozens of hair, facial hair, and body hair to choose from.There is lots of different clothing items; badges, necklaces, earings, piercings, t-shirts, shirts, cargo pants, jeans, skinny pants, sweatpants... Not to mention that you can add custom decals to your clothes, and paint♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ suspenders, arm patches, emblems, buttons, nametags, etc.You even have an in-game music editor, in which you can make your short "signature" song.It also has a really big collection of nice songs in the in-game radio, and you can also add your own music to your music player.I haven't played in a while, so I can't think of more at the moment, but I know that there are a LOT more customization features than what I've mentioned.  I wish it had houses.   This would be awesome, imagine all the Sims fans coming to the game, haha.Paid contentSince I started playing I kept hearing new/unskilled players moaning about "pay 2 win". There is no pay to win in the game. You can pay, yes. But paying only gives you less customization limits, and it gives you some weapons that every player can obtain through a bit of grinding, except that you get some paintjobs, too.MissionsMissions usually don't take more than 20-30 minutes, and can sometimes be as short as 5 minutes, which is great if you just want a game to play after a long day. WeaponsAgain, if you just want a game to play after a long day, then this is for you. You can spent hundreds of hours grinding the game to get the finest weaponry in all of  Skyrim  San Paro, but you can perform just fine in the tracksuit, SCAR and that small electric-looking car that you get during the training once you learn how to use it.Investing any money (real or not) is not essential.Getting new weapons won't make you stronger, it only gives you the opportunity to use what suits you best.CommunityYes, there are prepubescent players screaming that you are a hacker, but luckily, there is no global chat, so you won't have to buy a new headset every week.There is plenty of people that you can just chill with in the social district, play hide and seek, ♥♥♥♥ around with animations (there are plenty of animations!), race, drive around...MarketIf you're not really a battle-born type of a person, you can just stick to the social district and make uniforms, cars, designer shoes, songs, or whatever for people, and get paid well for it.You can also be a smuggler, unlock higher-level items, and then sell them for more to lower-lever players.Keep in mind that if you wish to be a designer it will require some initial grinding to unlock clothing parts, decals, etc. TL;DR	 Ignore the bad comments. The game is free, the game doesn't require you to pay real money to win. It doesn't require you to pay in-game money to win. Install it and have fun on your own way (and there are many ways!).

content:
Posted: December 29, 2015
												I spent ages playing this game on several different characters. It was fun, but after the security updates these people created, everything went wrong. You try to message the "support" and nobody replies for ~15 days. I got banned for doing absolutely nothing, and when I tried to get my account back, I was told my account was found using "malicious files". Nobody had access to my account, I was getting banned for either being too good at times in the game (where people would report me for hacking when I wasn't) and the staff couldn't take a second to check my account and my files to see if I was actually doing anything. This community is filled with greedy people trying to get money from people and once they notice that certain people stop purchasing their G1 cash for a pay-to-win game, they stop caring about them. But hey, maybe you like this game. It became boring and repetitive anyway. Take it from someone who spent ~200 hours on the game on this account, it's not worth it. I've spent at least $150 on the game (and was gifted another $200, because my friends saw how I enjoyed this game), and in the end even after all the game time everything began to go downhill. The community, the staff, and the increased pay-to-win. Good luck if you still play, and try not to get banned for doing absolutely nothing wrong.Edit 8/4/16:I figured I would come back and see if anything was changed, and I wasn't as 'rusty' as I thought I would be. So I went and played around a bit for literally ~9 hours and got banned this morning. I contacted support requesting a refund for even the cheapest skateboard back accessory cause I am not dealing with anymore of this games bs.
