number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												I found out about this game through my "random links" method on Youtube (I click mindlessly untill something of interest pops up). It was a video made by a guy called Rapid99 titled "A Day of Impromptu Traffic Collisions" 


YouTube™ Video: APB: Reloaded - A Day of Impromptu Traffic Collisions 

			Views: 249,734		

			FOLLOW US ON TWITTER! twitter.com/Rapid99APB Just a compilation of video clips from a while back of us screwing around with some random street races.		

 which showed a bunch of moments from their so-called "street racing" with some pretty sweet cars and some pretty sweet clothes and stuff. At first I thought "Wow those cars and clothes look so cool" and "I can't think about the amount of work the devs put into those designs". Literally 5 minutes later I was marvelling at sped-up car customizations and "How-to" videos on the game's HUUUUUUGE amount of content. I mean, this game has the best customization options ever, and I doubt you can get anywhere this amout of content for FREE.A few days later, I was documenting myself on every single aspect of the game, so that I can get a head start when I will begin playing. In this time I also looked at some Steam reviews on this game, and everybody there was either saying "BEST GAME EVER" or "MOST UNBALANCED GAME EVER".Then I got the game.At first, I was enjoying myself with the carelessness of a newbie, that feeling before getting to know the ins and outs of the game and getting competitive. I was driving about and testing the gun mechanics, getting the feel of the interfaces, the control layout, everything. As I started playing more and more I came to realise that I was better off playing the game for a few days.This game is gonna be REALLY hard on a new player. Having to deal with veterans, pay to plays and the occasional hacker, smurf and griefer will put off most new players. But at the same time, it offers so much that it makes you come back and play: unlockable backstory emails with detailed narration, the occasional Armas daily events which grant you cool stuff, the unique combat mechanics like switching from left-handed aim to right-handed on the spot to lean over cover, learning how to use all the different weapons in the game (I think the number of unique weapons passed 50 a long time ago) and grenade cooking, the amount of cars, the map and all the tricks to gain positional advantage over the enemy team and the ground-breaking customization.In APB Reloaded, customization ranges from your car to your character to your gun. You can make a Domino's Pizza van or a street racer's dream car, you can make your character look like a sharp-suited professional or like a total fool and you can add skins to your guns, you can make your own death themes and logos and you can add perks to everything: make your car take less impact damage or make it self-destruct, make your character agile and weak or slow and resistant to damage and you can make your rifle reload and shoot really fast or make it really accurate with ammo to spare. The way you want to play is really up to you, and the game lets you do just about everything to help accomplish that.The missions are a bit underwhelming. You are most of the time given some reason why Enforcer faction X wants to ♥♥♥♥ with Criminal faction Y (or vice-versa) and you are sent to spray a wall, break some doors or steal some car, or defend and not let any of those events occur in the first place. You either progress until your team wins or you let the timer run out to win. There are also the events that can take place in free roam: bad guy A ram-raids some stores, steals some cars or mugs a bunch of pedestrians so he can take the stolen items to make some dirty money from a contact that he after has to turn into real money by taking it to the laundry. If cop guy B steps into action and witnesses the man doing those crimes, they can engage in a side mission where the cop has to take the dirty money to a police storage locker to get payed for the retrieved goods or the bad guy has to take the goods to another storage locker to get payed for the retrieved goods. The winner gets the dirty money multiplied based on a multiplayer determined by player Prestige (if Enforcer) or Notoriety (if Criminal): increasing your Prestige as a cop means taking out bad guys or stunning and arresting them, which increases your Presige a whole lot more, and it gets decreased by running over pedestrians and crashing your car into other pedestrian-driven cars, mailboxes, etc. Criminals increase Notoriety by running over people and crashing into stuff, killing Enforcers and it gets decreased by doing nothing.Now the game doesn't seem so bad after all, does it? All those traits SURELY have to compensate for the community's short-comings, right?No, they don't.There STILL are veterans, hackers, pay to plays, griefers and smurfs. And you will get virtually beaten into depression unless you stop playing or start joining them, or you get friends to play such a notorious game. Whichever path you choose, you will have a hard time coping with the circumstances. Not playing means losing out on a really awesome game, joining the ranks of the latter 4 means losing your honor and becoming a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ while becoming a veteran means enjoying the game at the expense of others since you will become a god at it, and finding friends to play outside of APB is REALLY hard and it will anger and sadden you while finding friends from inside the APB community means you get to spend less time with your IRL friends.In conclusion, this is a game which you have to dedicate yourself to if you want to enjoy it to its fullest, or you hate it and you never come back to playing it. There is no grey area, and it really is a shame, because this game really is one of the best sandbox games ever, and I look past the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ community and see the true and overlooked value.

content:
Posted: July 19, 2014
												Fun game to play solo. If you can find a group to do it with it's up there as one of my favorite shooters..  It's not a GTA MMO, more like cops and robbers-- strictly PVP.  The weapons are versatile, the scenery is beautiful and the customization is unmatched.  A word of advice though-- do not buy any weapon with real money. It's not worth it.  Buying clothes, sure? Buying weapons doesn't give you a real leg up, and they're all over priced and normally only last a few days.  I get why they have a rental system from a marketing standpoint. It's just kind of bull.  The driving is fun too....so so fun. The learning curve isn't steep, and generally they do a good job of keeping the bronze and gold players apart.

content:
Posted: February 10, 2016
												about the game: The good, the bad and the uglyThe good:-there is no other game like it-its not pay2win,the most powerful weapons are free-awezome costumization of character, symbols and carsThe bad:-HUGE skill diference between players (check notes at the end of the review)-every now and then a patch buffs a weapon that was not supposed to get buffed.-a few times missions needs balancing (drop points or timers will give an advantage to one of the teams)The ugly:-toxic community (not recommended for people that gets offended easly - might learn how to ignore toxic people if you survive enought in this game) (there is nice people, but the toxic people makes a lot of noise in this game)-its a third person shooter. it plays completely diferent from a first person shooter. so if you're used to CoD or CS, you will have to get used to a completely diferent kind of game.Notes:-it looks like g1 is working hard now to finish the engine upgrade - give them time. a lot of players are tired of waiting for it since it was announced some years ago, but they have now another company putting some pressure on them. also, it looks like they want to balance things out.-in this game, you recibe a threat level (it indicates how good you play). green,bronze,silver and gold. you're put automatically inside a district that is supposed to gather players from the same threat level. for (reasons), this doesnt happend. silver district is full of golds and bronze district is full of silvers. this creates something interesting: 2 worlds. the bronze district, where bronze and silvers hang out, a more newbie friendly place to learn the game. and the silver district, full of silvers that likes to take a big challange and golds. the silver districts will be hell on earth for all new players, they will be put against very strong oposition and wont have any chance of winning. yet, silvers and golds of the bronze district wont be as good and strong as silvers of the silver district.-the matchmaking system needs some work (its scheduled for rework after the engine update) it will work with whatever is on the district you're in. that means sometimes you will be fighting oposition way stronger than you, or way weaker than you. its something you have to get used to.-because of newbies being put against veterans, 2 things happends: 1- people start thinking there are a lot of hackers in this game (false - if we put a silver in CS:GO against a global elite and dont tell him anything, he will think the global elite is hacking) and 2- it looks like the game is P2W (again, false - most powerful weapons are free. but old players like to have permanent nice looking weapons, so they buy one with real money. as they have a lot more experience, they will always win the gunfights, and the new players tend to blame the gun for that)-you will need some patience to learn the game, its a diferent and unique kind of game. but if you know wich districts to be on your skill level, its a fun game, and worth it

content:
Posted: May 15, 2014
												I mean, its a free game, and its great for a free game, BUT you get what you pay for. Pros:     CUSTOMIZATION: you can pretty much customize everything, from the exact details and graphics that you design for your vehicles paint and graphics, the music thats played through your car stereo for other people to hear as well (made using a sythesia music making in game program featuring tons of different sounds and instruments, your tattoos, your theme (which people will hear after you kill them) - in my opinion there is so much customization in this game and its so smooth its probably one of the very top reasons for the game still being alive, you can even sell your songs, themes, and art on the auction house for cash (which is an amazing way to make money)    LOADOUTS: easy to change from your modded shotgun to your modded sniper from the in game weapon "machines" as well as your personal character mods, vehicle mods etc.    MULTIPLAYER: when you have your friends playing with you the fun doubles each time you add another friend to party, even though the in game chat is meh, if everyone is on skype coordinating attacks, ohh man everything is just so sweet.      Cons:     MATCHMAKING: it doesnt really exist in this game and its pretty bad, people can argue about the "bronze silver and gold servers"  but as a gold player, its easy to dethreat down to silver, join a bronze server, then just♥♥♥♥♥♥all the noobs because im feeling like i need to feel powerful or something. as a new player you will be going against these players and it will make your life a living hell because they have all of the "end game" mods, weapons, cars, and you dont. Some people argue that the only way to get better is to play against better people, but in this scenario its really ♥♥♥♥♥♥ =/  also if you are playing alone, this game could get really aggrivating due to non communicating or incompetent friendly firing teamates.     GUN DAMAGE RATIO: there are tons of guns in the game but because there are a select few that are just OP as hell, it makes everyone HAVE to go to that cookie cutter build.  put it like this, if 2 people of completely equal skill start shooting at each other at the exact same time with assault rifles but the same person keeps winning because his gun kills 2 seconds faster no matter what, it kind of leaves the other player crippled, this plays into matchmaking as well because the high ranking guy will always have a waaaaaay better gun than the bronze player      PAY 2 WIN: i agree that because the game is free, they have to make money somehow, but some of the guns in the armas market give you such an unfair advantage of anyone else and its complete BS, people will try to argue that there really is no difference here either, but those are the same people that payed for the guns and are♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥you with them, as a new player it takes you a long time to unlock a 3 slotted gun and the mods you need for it to compare to the market ones, so if you are new, you might as well just pay to buy a pre 3 slotted gun if you dont want to get stomped on.       CHEATERS: wow, just wow, ok so a ton of people get banned for cheating all the time, however it is in waves so nothing is stopping them from creating a new account and continueing, also there are paid hacks which are non detectable for the time being. So, when you arent getting♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by the good players who dethreat(deliberately level down just so they can join noob servers) you are getting♥♥♥♥♥♥♥by cheaters. a small % are blatant as hell cheaters (24 kills 0 deaths and literally 1v4 a team, cooking grenades and throwing them at you before you are even in sight, jumping off a building and sniping you in mid air etc etc).  the other large % are closet cheaters that will actually pretend to be legit and let you kill them, but you will never win a match against them. i understand its a PC game and all pc games especially like this are susceptible to hacks, but damn it can sure f this game up from 0-60 in 2 seconds.        MISSIONS&OBJECTIVES: maybe a little less than half of the time the objective will be extremely one sided, to the point where if the enemy team kills your team one time they will get such an unfair advantage to where your team would have to kill theirs 2 or 3 times, it goes both ways and its unfair no matter how you look at it, lets take the "keep possession of the suitcase final missions" for example, their team kills yours once and has enough time to put the suitcase in such an extremely hard area to access that even if you kill them all, they can all respawn and snipe you as you are trying to figure out how the F they put it on some seemingly impossible ledge to access, from that point its just waiting to lose because its bs. Or on occasion you will get the players who will get in the lead by 1 point or 1 kill, all get in cars and just run across the map, again, just wait till the time runs out to lose -_-       EXPLOSIVE WEAPONS: If there is any game that they dont belong in (which is MOST games)   its this one, if your team has no grenade launchers and theirs has 2, the match becomes a nightmare because all they will do is sit about 80-90 meters away from the objective that YOU have to capture, and they just launch rockets at it and grenades. some people argue "well its easy to dodge" or "they will run out of ammo". No and No.  its easy to dodge if you see them comming at you , but when its being launched NONSTOP SPAMMED from 80m away and you are trying to capture an objective, go outside on a rainy day and try to dodge all the raindrops.  They dont run out of ammo because they carry ammo crates and just stand on them for nearly infinite ammo, bummmerrrr... or when you need to drive to an objective and there is that same guy doing NOTHING but launching rockets at peoples cars, it really screws with the fun, hes litterally not even defending the objectives, hes just being an A-hole.    All in all the game is definately worth a try, its pretty easy to get into and it doesnt consume a lot of time, you can play for 20 minutes then go to work, so its not something you have to dedicate your life to, to be any good. the game is pretty softcore and casual, you will have the players who boast they are gold and are super pro and make jabs on bronze players, but gold threat is super easy to acheive, its not special. the customization is a huge thing, it other games had the customization like this one does they would be soooo much better, im pretty sure its one of the biggest things keeping this game alive. You cant go too wrong on a free game so you might as well give it a try, like i said though before in the cons... prepare to get♥♥♥♥♥♥♥and frustrated by cheaters and good players who de level on purpose because they are A-holes, just to kill noobs. For sure though you can put more time in it than you would a $60.00 game, so id say its worth the time.

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												I wasn't quite sure what to expect when I first picked up APB, but I have been pleased by what I found.  Basically, the game is like a multiplayer GTA, but what really makes it shine is the amount of customization possible.  Seriously, you can design and customize just about everything in the game, from your character, to your weapons, to your car.  What the game lacks, however, is any type of story.  This game is essentially all a PvP metagame, so don't be expecting an expansive deep world with lots of backstory and NPC characters because you won't find it.  What you will find however, is a fun free-to-play distraction that should help fill a gap between other games when you don't want something serious but just fun for a few hours.

content:
Posted: August 17, 2012
												If you don't know me, I'm Ethica, or Sparkshot in Joker East. I countless look at this game as the game that gave me joy and my aim. But the trials I've had to endure to enjoy this game will never make it worth it. The amount of things wrong with this game out matched the pros 10 fold. I continue to amaze myself about how mad I can get at this game. The trolls, with the awful hit reg, the repetitive missions. I can't take it. VIP MissionsThe main reason I'm writing this review. If you're not familiar with this game, there's a time of game mode called VIP, and it gives me a grey hair every time I play it. Basically, one team has a member whose labeled "VIP" and you have to take out just him, but if you die then they get a point, if the VIP dies, you get a point. It's at the point to where I want to quit every time I get into a VIP mission. Because the VIP can run while the other team can fight you, this game boasts about it's free roam but they take advantage of it. APB has tried to get rid of the camping spots, but people still camp, and run, and it's literally the worst game mode created. I wish they would take it out and leave TDM and capture points.GamersfirstI don't have to say much, they're greedy and never make good updates. It's always something new you can buy that only makes your experience worse when you realize how awful this game isCharacter CreationCharacter Creation was one of the main things that got me into APB. If you really want to look cool, you're going to need money or a lot of time unlocking all of the things. But Gamersfirst knows that some things are awesome so they charge 5 dollars for a backpack or a skateboard on your back. I can't stress how much money I've wasted on this god awful game.LagIf you don't spend 2,000 dollars on this game consider stutters or annoying spikes when people pump shotgun shells into you. This game uses an out of date Unreal Engine that makes everyone lag while playing. Doesn't matter how good your computer is, it will lag. I’m constantly saddened by telling my friends "hey, you can't play this game because of the horrible optimization." APB has told us that it's going to make a new engine. I'm not looking forward to it.I used to really enjoy this game but there are so many things that♥♥♥♥♥♥me off I can't deal with it I have to rant. If you're looking into trying this game out, I would just look a different way. This one won't fulfill any of your hopes. Thanks for reading I hope I changed some minds.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 12
												ok so this is one of the few games i will actually make a review for, it's going to be completely honest and it's going to shine more light than other reviews i've seen will. The positive things will have a + in the beginning negatives will have a --So to start off it's a pretty fun game, all tho it can be very triggering. It's indeed pay to win even tho some people say it's not. There are a ton of guns you can buy that are better than guns you're able to get in game early on i'm not sure if you still can but there was(might still be) an option to try a gun for i think it's like an hour or a couple(a gun you buy) which is very unique. Upon trying one i did see it was more accurate and seemed to do a shot or two more damage(meaning one or two shots less to kill someone)On the other hand if you can get well versed in certain guns you can still put up a fight. If you put a small amount of effort in you can actually almost hang with the p2w crowd. You unlock guns with slots for "mods" certain mods have certain buffs and debuffs ie hunter sight makes you less accurate while moving but makes you more accurate in marksman mode(rmb) and zooms a little further. These are completely f2p and the further you advance the more mods(up to 3) you can put on a gun. So p2w? Yes but is it severe p2w? No i have only a 1 mod and get plenty of kills playing smart so don't let it detur you.+The customization in the game is amazing, it's what makes APB well APB(besides the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ stuff) You can customize cars, your outfit, your clothes, your character look, music etc.. You can even make themes(songs) and symbols(designs) and sell them along with cars and clothes. So you can even relax for a bit make some cool designs and sell them or even make cars and sell them which is pretty awesome(i love buying customized cars). There's a ton of different cars that people who buy the kits can customize(including rims, sounds, body kits etc...) which is awesome it makes the game that much more fun driving in a awesome car.+There's some pretty cool faction based content, ie if you're a criminal(i am) you can mug pedestrians(lolol) for money or take a car and smash into certain places and steal stuff which you sell to certain people and then you launder the money. The higher wanted level you are(at 5 anyone can attack you) the more money you get when laundering. However after i believe about 5k an enforcer can witness you at any time and fight you for your money. As said before enforcers can witness you do certain things and arrest or engaged in a pvp mission with you.+++++ You can upload music into the apb music player and play it while you're well playing. It's pretty awesome to run around and cause havoc while blasting your favorite music, it also will play out of your car if you're in it which is awesome.----- The rank and MM system has been severely abused and has been allowed to be, hopefully they fix the♥♥♥♥♥♥show. In APB you can que for missions in which you get matched with people of your faction randomly and are sent to do open world activities for a crim such as burning a car or breaking into somewhere etc.. If a enforcers is qued up they will usually be dispatched against you in which the two factions fight while doing missions. The reason this is broken is because ranks(i think trainee, bronze, silver then gold) can play in the servers of one rank below. So silvers can go into bronze etc... which is not the end of the world i guess but it has been abused because there's plenty of golds who derank to say silver go into bronze then just sit in bronze rank back up to gold then sit in bronze as a p2w gold all day that's when it really gets to be a nightmare.honestly i give this game a 7/10the p2w is not too p2w, you can still get some kills and feel impactfulthe mm system and ranking is asscrack(if they made it so say you get gold in bronze you get kicked it would be 1000x better)the customization of the game, the customization of vehicles and being able to play music make this game pretty fun to play right off the bat.Once you get over the hump of not having a mod slot gun the game becomes enjoyable if you play it right.

content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												While not the best sandbox game around, APB Realoaded gives you a great online world for you to play in with your friends! The map list is a bit short at the moment but this can easily be fixed with updates. The Character creator also is very nice and has some depth to it, allowing you to make a really unique character. The microtransactions are a pain but they can easily be ignored. Weapons are also a pain as you can only buy them temporarily unless you spend real money but this also doesn't ruin gameplay, as the starting weapons are pretty good. Veichles also have a decent amount of customizeation, letting you put your own logos on and you alos use those same logos on your clothing or as tatoos!

content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												Its a decent game, with great content. but all of the weapons and vehicles are purchased for 1 day, 7 days, month, or permanent. Permanent costs real money or so much money it would take you weeks to months to afford a car. Game is a basic pay to win game, with content that requires ingame money that you can take FOREVER, or you can use real money to get what you want. If you have multiple friends that play this game, then investing is not a bad idea. GTA 5 is a newer version of a freeroam MMO, but lacks the content as APB/ customization.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 8, 2015
												While this game is considerably pay-to-win, I still find it has a certain appeal to it, despite that being a large downfall. I enjoy it with friends, mostly, this game seems to fall short when you play solo, it becomes more frustrating than anything. My main problem is the ranking system. There are four skill groups; Green, Bronze, Silver, and Gold. The skill groups work, but the issue is - Gold's can play in Silver servers, and Silver's can play in Bronze servers. This leads to the Gold servers never having more than three people at a time in each, forcing all Gold players into Silver servers and shaving a large amount of Exp and Cash from their missions. It also forces the Silver players into Bronze servers, solely for the fact that the skill difference between groups is large enough, that it's hard to play against the next rank above you.

content:
Posted: June 19, 2014
												Graphics: 7/10(it looks sort of dated but I guess it is understandable to minimize rendering since this is a sort of MMO game)Sound/Voice Acting: 6/10(not really that impressive but okay I guess)Gameplay: 6/10(it is okay from the start but gets really repetitive even if you are playing with other people. Character customization is oaky too but again eventually gets boring)Story/Plot: N/A(long story short ~ cops vs. robbers)Final Verdict:Although the intention for this game was clearly to bring a GTA feeling game and turn it into an active online community, I'd say they did hit some spots but missed a lot. The game feels raw and the gameplay in itself can become repetitive.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												APB Reloaded is a fantastic hellhole of a game. It has been around a while and has seen some tough times. That said, I keep going back to it, and can't stop playing it. It is essentially a free GTA Online. Matchmaking mechanics are wonky, the graphics are outdated, the physics are bizzare, and the in-game community is ridden with griefers. But the gameplay is incredibly addictive and the premise of street fighting in California has some strange draw to it.If you want to roll around and do raw hoodrat♥♥♥♥♥♥with your friends for free, look no further. If you're looking for a quality experience though, you might want to try elsewhere.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												APB Reloaded is a great game, but is extremely hard at the begining. It take quite some time to get used to game mechanics, teamplay, map and so on but once you are done with it, you will never stop playing. The game has huge potencial, limitless customizaton and tons of content. Thou some of it is buyable with real money only. But fortunatly the game is SKILL BASED. number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												"Fresh and New" free to play.With a lot of free to play titles, people complain. Concidering that the title is free, I don't understand that.Anyways, out of the limited time I played, it takes a longer then normal time to understand things. The tiny yet steap learning curve might make you uninstall it out of rage. Beyond that, APB is a reasonable F2P game.Graphics can be scaled, and durring my time, AA was in beta (how, I do not know). Nothing to blow you out of the water, but solid attempt at reasonable graphics in a free title.Would I give this a thumbs down? No way. Would it be a "must play"? No. Is it horrible? No. You have nothing to gain or loose by wasting a few hours on this -- or by not installing and playing.6.5/10

content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												This game has made me feel levels of anger previously unachieved by man.This game's players (read: hackers), however, created something truly glorious that my friends and I will never forget. It only happened once, and it has never truly occurred again ever since. For the duration of one mission, I became the incarnation of screaming, wrath, and comedy. My rage was the rage of an infinite number of sweaty nerds. My unquellable anger extended beyond the deepest voids of the universe and all dimensions, and then it happened.I was happy.I had literally gotten so angry that I had looped back around to happy. But the wrath remained.And he had awakened.When he was a part of me, he was called NEGROCITY, THE RAGELORD.But as the mission ended, so too did our brief ascension to the next level of humanity.With our remaining wrath, he ascended to the next plane of existence, as was his destiny. Alone, he shed the name Negrocity, becoming simply The Ragelord. I chose to remain here among the world of men. Godspeed, Ragelord. We'll never forget you."YES! YES!!! I ♥♥♥♥ING LOVE BULLETS!!!" -Negrocity, being shot in the chestIt's an alright game if you enjoy everlasting agony.

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												APB Reloaded is a fantastic hellhole of a game. It has been around a while and has seen some tough times. That said, I keep going back to it, and can't stop playing it. It is essentially a free GTA Online. Matchmaking mechanics are wonky, the graphics are outdated, the physics are bizzare, and the in-game community is ridden with griefers. But the gameplay is incredibly addictive and the premise of street fighting in California has some strange draw to it.If you want to roll around and do raw hoodrat♥♥♥♥♥♥with your friends for free, look no further. If you're looking for a quality experience though, you might want to try elsewhere.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 10, 2014
												This game has a fantastic concept. Free, open-world, full customization of your character, go on missions with new people; all this stuff makes for a pretty fun game...but the game is extremely unbalanced. Because of this inbalance, it has caused more rage than it has fun. When you are matched against players that are on your level, it is very very fun. But the chances of this happening are extremely slim. Chances are, when you are starting out, you'll be against so players with better skill, better weapons, and better experience. If you don't pay for the bonus weapons, you're going to fall behind and it'll take quite a while for you to catch up to the players that you get matched with. Often times when I play this, I think about how much more fun I could have playing something else where the matchmaking isn't so imbalanced.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 17, 2012
												If you don't know me, I'm Ethica, or Sparkshot in Joker East. I countless look at this game as the game that gave me joy and my aim. But the trials I've had to endure to enjoy this game will never make it worth it. The amount of things wrong with this game out matched the pros 10 fold. I continue to amaze myself about how mad I can get at this game. The trolls, with the awful hit reg, the repetitive missions. I can't take it. VIP MissionsThe main reason I'm writing this review. If you're not familiar with this game, there's a time of game mode called VIP, and it gives me a grey hair every time I play it. Basically, one team has a member whose labeled "VIP" and you have to take out just him, but if you die then they get a point, if the VIP dies, you get a point. It's at the point to where I want to quit every time I get into a VIP mission. Because the VIP can run while the other team can fight you, this game boasts about it's free roam but they take advantage of it. APB has tried to get rid of the camping spots, but people still camp, and run, and it's literally the worst game mode created. I wish they would take it out and leave TDM and capture points.GamersfirstI don't have to say much, they're greedy and never make good updates. It's always something new you can buy that only makes your experience worse when you realize how awful this game isCharacter CreationCharacter Creation was one of the main things that got me into APB. If you really want to look cool, you're going to need money or a lot of time unlocking all of the things. But Gamersfirst knows that some things are awesome so they charge 5 dollars for a backpack or a skateboard on your back. I can't stress how much money I've wasted on this god awful game.LagIf you don't spend 2,000 dollars on this game consider stutters or annoying spikes when people pump shotgun shells into you. This game uses an out of date Unreal Engine that makes everyone lag while playing. Doesn't matter how good your computer is, it will lag. I’m constantly saddened by telling my friends "hey, you can't play this game because of the horrible optimization." APB has told us that it's going to make a new engine. I'm not looking forward to it.I used to really enjoy this game but there are so many things that♥♥♥♥♥♥me off I can't deal with it I have to rant. If you're looking into trying this game out, I would just look a different way. This one won't fulfill any of your hopes. Thanks for reading I hope I changed some minds.

content:
Posted: August 21, 2014
												APB: Reloaded is a really good, and in my opinion, a well thought out game for the style it revolves around. I personally loved the customization of the character creation, as well as for the vehicles. I won't lie and say I enjoyed the game to the fullest, but it was on my side, for the sole fact that I'm not on a gaming rig, but even through the lag I had while playing this game, I did enjoy it. The community isn't THEE best, but there are some friendly faces in-game, and in all honesty, this game doesn't require much "skill" to be good, I personally think it mainly depends on how good or bad of a system you have, in order handle being able to fight back when in a competative scenerio. Over all though, the game was fun, I just recommend you have decent specs before playing, because you won't get the best gaming experience otherwise.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												APB:R is a mechanically solid game with amazing customization options -including an option to upload your own music and play it with an in-game radio, but it's seriously marred by punishing hardware demands and one of the worst communities not actually directly affiliated with an organized Hate Group.APB:R's got a mean learning curve, too, and not just in terms of gun fighting. High skill players also know the city and it's many alleys, highways, ramps, and neighborhoods quite well, and being travel time efficient is one of the greatest advantages for completing missions. You'll need to know the weapons as well and that's also not a trivial task.The setting's quite detailed as well and fairly intriguing. There's a lot going on in this tale of a city committing suicide to save it's life and it's told from many different perspectives by a few dozen well composed NPC's. Shame it's also not an ongoing story.A word on microtransactions: there are quite a few of them, and more coming all the time. Much of it is exclusive, but usually cosmetically. If you don't care what your OCA or NTEC looks like, you can unlock -permanently- weapons that'll perform just about as well as anything that costs real money. In terms of what's "necessary" Premium time nearly doubles your income and contact progression rate, and that'll really start to tell once you get deep into the game and start seeing max level 15 contacts.And much as APB:R's servers look like a dumping ground for unwanted (and tragically unaborted) children get this straight: it's a business, not a public park. Servers cost money, money means selling stuff. Get over it, or uninstall.APB:R has a real and an active hacker problem. The worst offenders are the Americans, so keep off the game during American holidays and afternoon hours. Fair Fight helps, but it's bad to the point of hacker cadres bragging about how they stay in APB:R just to ♥♥♥♥ with the devs, and who can point you at all their favorite forums and programs. In Global Chat -just ask.(Here's a good unofficial metric: read through the comments for this game that accompany any dev announcement or piece of news. Assume half the people denying hacking are doing it themselves. Say that's about %10, 1 in 5x2. Now go play, and remember that number when you realize that these folks are the most active players when you see a newly minted rank 80 burn through your entire team with an unmodded Joker rifle.Sure his K/A/D is 17-3-0, but he's "just that good."Especially with one of the worst weapons in the game*.So _pro_.That he's also driving a completely stock version of the basic free car also means nothing -he just decided to reroll.So what's suspicious about an unbelievably expert player with a Gold skill ranking in a game built on long-term progression and customization who likes to use a completely basic gun and restart at random?And who apparently can track you through walls?Can make jumping max-range hits on targets behind 90% cover with a sniper rifle?I sound salty; I am.I've seen this scenario play itself out _dozens_ of times.If APB:R finally succumbs I'll miss it because truly there isn't much like it anywhere.But I won't wonder why.I'm recommending APB:R because there is a lot to love, but it's drowning in a sewage sump of the worst people you can find online. And no mistake, "drowning" is no exaggeration.  The devs keep patching and updating slowly and regularly, but the handicap of it's unbelievably vile community must cripple the growth it needs to stay online. F2P is a great model that only works if new people show up to buy, and given few actual new players stick around and that there's an upcoming global server merge doesn't say to me that it'll survive if it doesn't find some effective solution to it's many gloating and vocal cancers. There's a play engine upgrade coming (eventually) and that'll probably be the make-or-break point when the stresses of the (realistically) many implementation bugs makes players who didn't log in to ♥♥♥♥ with someone else wonder if they've got the patience to deal with everything they don't like about APB:R showing up while everything they play it for is in a limbo of bugs and disconnections.Bottom line: bring your A game and your thickest skin, and stay off the servers during weekends unless you bought better aimbots than the other guys.*The Joker SR-15 is inferior to just about every other rifle in every way except these: RoF and magazine size.Critically rifles, not SMG's or AR's, don't have iron sights. They're meant to be light marksman's weapons with above average per-round damage that do poorly at close range.Our friend being described above will be running and leaping as he hip-fires his weapon.That has no crosshairs and a deviation box the size of a baseball diamond.At max RoF....GG.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 20, 2015
												Spent three hours in a mock demolition derby and poledancing on top of other people's cars, paid off cops who pulled me over for speeding with a safe full of diamonds I'd just stolen right in front of them, 20/10 would play again. To be honest, 9.5/10 people who try to play APB are going to be slavering at the jaws with rage within 15 minutes of entering their first server. The game is heavilly PvP orientated... Unfortunately, the PvP is weighted heavilly in favor of anyone who pays exorbant sums of money for the best gear. Not to mention the highly experienced, well-geared high levels that come to the starting areas to murder new players. In terms of concept and general gameplay, APB is a wonderful game. Imagine an MMO version of Saints Row or GTA, with players being both criminals and cops. That's the general idea behind APB Reloaded. Unfortunately, as mentioned before, the player versus player that is cventral to the concept is horribly unbalanced. To give you an example, a fresh player with reasonable third person shooter experience can pick up a weapon off the real money market and dominate matches just like that. Now imagine an experienced player with that same weapon. It's one of those cases of a free-to-player attacking a paying player and the paying player essentially going "Lol, stop it, it tickles! Here, have some bullets!" I've touched on the subject a bit already... The game's community. To be frank, APB's community is utterly terrible, filled with asshats, trolls, and plenty of children who think they're MLG level hot stuff. Combine this with that pay-to win imbalance... Yeah, a ten year old with his daddy's credit card will kick your♥♥♥♥♥more times than you'd care to admit. And both children and adults will announce their pro skills and taunt each other and whine about Haxoorz in the chat. Oh yeah. Hackers. They're there. Not as much as a lot of the people in the game would tell you they are (Every time they die) but they're definately there and a force to be reckoned with. Did I mention the customization? I didn't mention that, did I? silly me. The level of customization you can apply to your character and vehicle is... Mind-boggling. Simply glorious. It's the main strength of the game, in my opinion, but unfortunately it's subscribed to that same Pay-to-win philosophy as the rest of the game... Less so, however. Put enough time into it, and you, as a free to player, can potentially look just as cool as that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ who sunk 2000 bucks into his kit. He may be able to one-shot you with his god-pistol from a mile away, but hey, at least you'll leave a cool-looking corpse! My advice for playing this game? Avoid actually playing the game like you're supposed to. Don't play the PvP, you're bound only for frustration and rage. Do side activities, They award more cash faster and, while they can get a bit monotonous, there's plenty of ways to stay entertained. Remember what I said about the demolition derby? Actually happened. There's plenty of people in the game that are just as bored as you. Oh, yeah, there are decent people, it's just that the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s are pretty loud. Criminals can make cash a lot faster than Enforcers, simply because their activities are largely dependant on the envirionment- mugging, robbing stores, jacking cars, you get the picture- whereas most of the Enforcer's income is largely dependant on criminals. And that PvP. You want cash as an enforcer? Gotta engage criminals in PvP to get it. Which is probably why the beginner areas are always swamped with high-level Enforcers. They want some easy cash. Honestly most of this game's problems can be traced back to the Pay-to-Win PvP and the Enforcer's lack of quick cash income. THe only way to really have any fun with this game is to♥♥♥♥♥♥around. As a free-to-player, attempting to take the game seriously will only end in your frustration. I rate the game's premise 9/10, but the game in it's current state 3/10. TL;DR: You're going to die to kids with their daddy's credit card a lot. Look forward to a toxic community and lots of salt in the area chat 24/7. Hey, the character customization is really kick♥♥♥♥♥ though!

content:
Posted: February 21, 2016
												What about this game? Well In general it's a Great Game.What's great about it? Well let's start off with the type of player you are.Basically I probably Just split to 3.If you are the type of guy/girl that loves to play a game for it's customization (Wink Wink Me) and obviously play shooter games in general (FPS/3rdPS) then APB:Reloaded has done it right. The shapes they provide is not alot but enough for you to find shapes to go to your design. Of coaurse this comes with a draw back which is the ammount of shapes you can put in. Where you have to get premium in order to get the best experience.I'm sure there are players who Just want to play it and meet friends depending on the other party If he/she is friendly and wants to make new friends or just plain playing with friends for the fun of it like CS:GO then this is also probably for those type of people,There are also the players that wanted to get GTA V BUT can't afford it. APB:Reloaded is another small game Just like it and for those players to enjoy. Sure you won't get the full experience of how GTA V actually plays. But it's close enough that people who play GTA:SA will stay in the game for a couple of months.Those to me is what make APB:Reloaded a Great Game to me. BUT Obviously there are drawbacks.The Animations/World/Lighting arn't the best BUT It will do just fine. Even tho Reloaded Productions Keeps teasing us about the new Engine or Lighting.........

Bi süre sonra herkes bıraktı ve bende sıkıldım bıraktım 2015 oldugunda tekrardan başladım ve gene harika zamanlar geçirdim ki oyundaki türkler gerçekten çok içten insanlar onlarla tanıştığınız zaman fark edersiniz :). Ama artık gamersfirst diğer bi tabirle moneyfirst herşeyi paraya bağladı bi silah gelmişti adını hatırlamıyordum silahla uzaktan sniper avlıyorduk taramalı aldık sonra nerf yedi yani ekmeğini yiyince direk nerflüyorlar. Ve artık o kadar çok hile varki neredeyse her oyunda hile ile karşılaşır olduk hile sistemi harika aslında ama (FairFight) nedense banlanmıyorlar bende anlamıyorum bu olayi büyük ihtimalle para ile satın alınan hilelerdir. Oyuna başlamanızı kesinlikle tavsiye etmiyorum acayip saçma kasmalar tuhaf tuhaf laglardan deli olacağınız kesin. Amerikada Oynamıyorsanız başlamayın daha doğrusu orda gerçekten daha az ping oluyor 200 ping var ama nedense kasma lag vb şeyler yok hilede yok işin doğrusu bizzat kendim denediğim için söylüyorum. Ama dediğim sorunlar olmasa gerçekten çok eğlenceli bi oyun olduğu kesin. Benim için sorun yok derseniz bi deneyin derim :). İyi Günler Herkese.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 28, 2015
												I actually have over 1,000 hours of my life wasted on this game that aren't logged on Steam. What a waste! Anyway, this game is on life support and the cheating will always be in full force, this is coming from a previous legitimate Gold 10 ranked player who has been around since RTW released it. The community just totally sucks and is very small and you will always run into the same old awful people who have been playing this game forever but, the dime-a-dozen cheaters on freshly made accounts every other match are just as common! Personally, running into the same awful people over and over is not only tiresome - it's also awkward and draining as they have no intention of being friendly. The only reason I keep it installed at this point is to paint vehicles once in a blue moon with the graphic design tool the game provides. Speaking of vehicles, the cars look great but, drive like boats on ice, it's almost as bad as Watch Dogs' driving mechanics. Anyway, I do have to give this game some credit and thanks for something, for its customization tools. Once upon a time, this game inspired me to create vehicle paint jobs, grafitti and graphic designs and it really helped point me in the direction I wanted to go in life. I was accepted into several art schools and I used some of my work on APB in my portfolio. On that note, all of the other artists and decent players I knew on APB? Gone. All that's left are the dregs at this point - the worst of the worst. With the artistic talent gone (even the official lead concept artist left APB), you just have a bunch of washed up veterans along with a load of cheaters in a game that hasn't had any actual new places to go or things to do since its inception. Sound terrible? It gets worse.Speaking of its great customization, if you think you'll see incredible player-made works of art these days - guess again! The most remarkable things you'll see are trolls with genitalia tattoo'd all over themselves or bootlegged Monster Energy Drink cars. Oh and in the 5 whole years since it killed the original company that created it, the only new content that has been added to the game are new guns... That you can only buy with real money and it's not cheap, it's 30$-60$ a weapon and you can not resell or trade them, no returns or exchanges. For that much money, you can just buy a game on here that doesn't suck - at least Steam will give you a refund if you don't like it. At this point, GTA V (Online) is a thing and it's great, it completely outshines this travesty. The best choice if you're considering playing this game is: to pretend this game doesn't exist. Not a hard choice to make at this point since it's completely irrelevant and has been since it flopped and got shut down all those years ago.The good part about this game? Well, it's a great thing that works to contain the awful kind of people who still play it everyday! Horrible driving, mediocre gunplay, dated graphics, mouse acceleration, memory leaks, terrible camera positioning. Yeah, some people who don't know any better actually like this crap in 2015. You can only imagine how wonderful they are. I sincerely hope all of the cheaters and other idiots that still enjoy it, all 400 (on a good day) of them left on their dead US server, stay there and keep their internet AIDS to themselves.My final verdict? It's a bad game full of bad people. Only play it if you want to exercise your skill, to paint and design some clothing and vehicles.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 30, 2015
												APB is the one game ive played that ive had as much fun winning in, its rewarding, satisfying on so many levels. But its also one of the most frustrating and cheater filled games you'll find. But since they added the new anti-cheat system called "Fairfight" its been a severe change amongst the opposition you face. Most of the time its good fun and great players, but at many points during missions you will encounter people that are questionable at best. Its widely known that cheaters still exist within APB Reloaded and it doesnt feel like the developers are actually taking it as seriously as some would want.The game itself is based highly on the Ingame Marketplace that you spend real life cash in to procure lifetime bonuses such as weaponry, vehicles, clothing and the infamous "Joker boxes" that personaly i bought over a 100 of, and never got any good loot from. Supposedly the boxes have a chance to drop legendary weapons such as the even more infamous "OCA Nano" machine pistol. Its the most overpowered weapon in the game as its capable of literally wiping the floor with enemy opposition up too 100 meters(The maximum sight range ingame) even at full auto(LoL) But even with the problems that exist in the game its still one of the few games ive spent over 1000 hours playing and still play from time to time. Like previously stated, you arnt likely to find a game that is as satisfying to win in as in APB.If the gameplay doesnt do everything for you there is the most advanced character customization existing so far in any kind of MMO's out there, and you can spend hour after hour just modifying, adding tattoos, painting cars, and not actually doing anything else.8/10

content:
Posted: January 4, 2014
												I wasn't quite sure what to expect when I first picked up APB, but I have been pleased by what I found.  Basically, the game is like a multiplayer GTA, but what really makes it shine is the amount of customization possible.  Seriously, you can design and customize just about everything in the game, from your character, to your weapons, to your car.  What the game lacks, however, is any type of story.  This game is essentially all a PvP metagame, so don't be expecting an expansive deep world with lots of backstory and NPC characters because you won't find it.  What you will find however, is a fun free-to-play distraction that should help fill a gap between other games when you don't want something serious but just fun for a few hours.

content:
Posted: April 15, 2016
												As someone who has playing for about a year with almost 400+ hours stored up, I feel I need to clear some bad rep. The game does have its faults, and the market system can seem a bit jacked up, but people fail to try to look at the good things compared to the bad.Cons:The matchmaking should be improved as well as server regulation of high threat levels. Also, it should be made aware that some people learn faster than others, so don't just think that just because someone keeps owning you, that you suck or he is cheating.Tutorials and game information needs to be much more accessible and easier to understand and more in-depth than current ones. The tutorials should also give some explanation to threat levels and how the game mechanics work.Community support should be taken more into consideration. I'm not saying the developers do whatever the community tells them they need to do, but the community needs to be better considered, and developers need to explain that they are doing their best and it takes lots of time to make code and system changes in the game.The armas marketplace needs to make pricing a bit more fair and cheaper, as well as maybe allowing permanent guns available through contacts. Also, it may help to point out that it could be better if they allowed some sort of G1C to in-game cash converter so the social marketplace is more fair, as well as maybe a player trade option.Finally, the game should try to support VAC since they can help ban people who truly need to be banned.Pros:It's considered a p2w, but if think about it, its really a pay-to-develop or pay-to-play, since the devs need lots of money to pay their people. It takes about 6 months to make a system code change, and that can only be done be a certain individual, so cut the guys some slack.Customization, if done appropriately, can lead to numerous different styles and expressions of personalities, beliefs, or to their liking. Plus, the game's cars and guns are balanced for every play style and tactic out there.There are some people, like myself, that are willing to offer help to new players, and are willing to bestow our knowledge to help the player not feel like that every mission is a pain in the neck. Also, the clan system can really help a new player, as most clans are around to help new players get started, or to provide a sense of hospitality and friendship to those who need it in this game.The guns in the armas marketplace and the legendary weapons in joker boxes are not OP or p2w guns. Some are mod-able re-skins of in-game weapons like the joker cr5 to the ntec-5 or the ump is to the pmg. Also, just because a high rank or new player has a VBR "huntress" or a Medusa doesn't mean he paid money to buy it, cause some people save up millions of in-game cash to actually buy the gun.Also, the replay value of the game is massive, especially if you only played as an enforcer or criminal to max rank. There will be days when you feel down cause you can't seem to win a mission, and days that you feel like a champ for doing better than normal, but it's really worth it. If you look up and know how the game works, and listen to experienced players' advice, you will be coming back for a good time.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
												I say skip this game, I mean, I've been playing this game for sometime, but I just always feel cheated. This game is super pay to win. The character creation is great, there is so much you can do to edit your character, but that's pretty much the games only strong point. For a City in War between Criminals and Enforcers the city looks pretty clean. Matchmaking is also really unbalanced. One moment you'll be going against players who are around your skill level, the next you're up against dudes with rocket launchers and guns that can much more dps then your own. The music in the game is pretty bad too, I can't remember or think of one track that sounded good, but you can add your own music to it, sadly you're the only one who can hear it. Over all I give it a 4/10 it's a good idea for a game, and it's all there but they just care to much about getting their money rather then making new players feel welcomed or making things seem even between the players. Perhaps a fix for the game would be making AI to fight, and giving players easier training, but then again, it's a pure PvP game, so what do I know?

content:
Posted: December 18, 2013
												"Fresh and New" free to play.With a lot of free to play titles, people complain. Concidering that the title is free, I don't understand that.Anyways, out of the limited time I played, it takes a longer then normal time to understand things. The tiny yet steap learning curve might make you uninstall it out of rage. Beyond that, APB is a reasonable F2P game.Graphics can be scaled, and durring my time, AA was in beta (how, I do not know). Nothing to blow you out of the water, but solid attempt at reasonable graphics in a free title.Would I give this a thumbs down? No way. Would it be a "must play"? No. Is it horrible? No. You have nothing to gain or loose by wasting a few hours on this -- or by not installing and playing.6.5/10

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 25, 2015
												This game has made me feel levels of anger previously unachieved by man.This game's players (read: hackers), however, created something truly glorious that my friends and I will never forget. It only happened once, and it has never truly occurred again ever since. For the duration of one mission, I became the incarnation of screaming, wrath, and comedy. My rage was the rage of an infinite number of sweaty nerds. My unquellable anger extended beyond the deepest voids of the universe and all dimensions, and then it happened.I was happy.I had literally gotten so angry that I had looped back around to happy. But the wrath remained.And he had awakened.When he was a part of me, he was called NEGROCITY, THE RAGELORD.But as the mission ended, so too did our brief ascension to the next level of humanity.With our remaining wrath, he ascended to the next plane of existence, as was his destiny. Alone, he shed the name Negrocity, becoming simply The Ragelord. I chose to remain here among the world of men. Godspeed, Ragelord. We'll never forget you."YES! YES!!! I ♥♥♥♥ING LOVE BULLETS!!!" -Negrocity, being shot in the chestIt's an alright game if you enjoy everlasting agony.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 24, 2015
												While not the best sandbox game around, APB Realoaded gives you a great online world for you to play in with your friends! The map list is a bit short at the moment but this can easily be fixed with updates. The Character creator also is very nice and has some depth to it, allowing you to make a really unique character. The microtransactions are a pain but they can easily be ignored. Weapons are also a pain as you can only buy them temporarily unless you spend real money but this also doesn't ruin gameplay, as the starting weapons are pretty good. Veichles also have a decent amount of customizeation, letting you put your own logos on and you alos use those same logos on your clothing or as tatoos!

												After 3 years of playing it,I can make a review:First of all,this game is in the category "pay2win",for example a DLC with a few costumes,vehicles and some weapons that are NOT permanent costs 93€.Not to mention that you can really enjoy this game after you pay at least 100$..These are the pros:-Great character and vehicle customization,it even include a symbol designer,which you can use for creating your own symbol-Each mission has his own story,like delevering a briefcase or killing the opposite teamCons:-You have to pay at least 100$ to enjoy-Laggy-Still full of bugs-Hackers-The gold ranked players invading silver ranked servers-It gets boring,it has only 2 mission districs,1 social(in which you can customize your character,vehicle and socialize),and 2 other districts in which is only team deathmatch;excluding events-♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t community,if you haven't spent 50$ or more you are considered a "noob"-If you are new or think of start playing this game,you stand no chance agains the player with OP weapons that cost over 500$.Back in 2011/2012 it was better,even thought were still some problemsMy rating for this "game" is 5/10

												APB Reloaded is a mass-multiplayer "sorta open world" third person shooter/objective based game. I find it very fun in my opinion and even better when you're playing online with a good group of friends. The objectives vary, and I find them enjoyable as well as not too reptetative, the only problem I think this game has is that the enforcer role seems to be a little too OP when they are equiped with a tazer/stun gun. I know people counter this by stating that criminals do make money quicker, but I still think that the stun gun is rather unfair. However, this is just my opinion and someone else may feel differently towards it. But, if massive-multiplayer, online, third-person shooters sounds exciting to you, than this game is perfect.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 18, 2016
												How can this game be on Steam? There is lag every day and the game is so unbalanced, ritteled with P2W weapons, yes, P2W. Some people claim that the weapon are situational, which is true to some extent, but overall there are a selection of weapons that picked over other weapon because they are generally superior to other weapons. This game should be removed from Steam because it does not reach the quality that Steam should require from games. The developers are ignoring all the problems, gold servers are never used, the threat system is completely broken, gold players play on Silver districts and silver players play on Bronze districts.The amount of players who use aimbot and triggerbot are staggeringly high. Every day you run into someone who kills an entire opposed team with secondary weapons. I don't understand why they don't change the anti-cheat system when the current one is obviously a total failure.This is APB: server lag, weapons that are op(like ATAC, which they intentionally do not nerf, just to sell it for a while), fun as hell when there are no cheaters(car chases, fast-pased action), cheaters, griefers, stutter-lag, broken match-making, broken threat system, in-depth customization...The cons far outweighs the pros, so remove it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 22, 2016
												Hmmm..... what do i think about this gameI FOCKIN LOVE IT (not.........kinda?)I played this game for the customization and the cars ( i love cars, i spend half of my playtime drifting.)This game has a REVOLUTIONARY customization system, need for speed barely come close. pffft, and you though that game was cool! (but yea, we dont have the capacity for infinite decals....that kinda sucks.) I mean, you can create your own decals if you dont love the stuff you get, but guess how you make your decals? you use the game's! using squares, triangles, and hundreds of other shapes, you can create masterpeices you can stick on yourself and your vehicles! using the huge amount of clothes and stuff, you can make your character look any way you want him to look! (Some items and such may require alot more playtime to unlock then others, though.) Cars though, may be alot harder to unlock, and even harder to customize, because you get such a small decal limit to work with as a free-to-play.This game.........is free to play, you only get one permanent weapon in the game other the the starter one, which you actually get to choose pretty early on in the game....... the problem with choosing one weapon early on in the game is, though.... you dont know which weapon fits your playstyle or even which playstyle your even comfortable with! me, personally... i chose a sniper rifle which i thought was a one shot... it did not work out, i hate the playstyle i have to take with that weapon. that and the fact that the sniper rifle was not a one shot kill, the stats can look so deceiving, but in truth isn't a one-shot-ANYTHING weapon in this game.The game is pay to win, yes. But personally, i got what i wanted and came to this game for, so im happy, TAKE INTO CONSIDERATION THAT I HAVE NOT SPENT A DIME ON THIS GAME. Actually, i have spend a dime.. 200 dimes... you know what that did?? nothing. i spend my 20 dollars expecting in-game currency (G1C, also known as G1 credits.) and what came out?? nothing... and nothing apeared on my purchase history, either!. so thats 20 bucks down the drain.The benifits of becoming a premium member and spending money on this game are really nice, though. so dont be scared to borrow mum's wallet with the intention to spend 10 dollars on a game where you run over innocent civilians and kill people mericlessly :D. Becoming a premium member can bring enourmous customization oppurtunities, allowing you to fit so many more decals on yourself and your car! Also, if you do spend money on G1C, you must get a gun from the armas marketplace before doing ANYTHING ELSE. but beware, some guns on there are utter crap, too. so do research and pick the correct gun, so you dont waste your prescious money..to those of you people who dont want to spend money on this game, if you are smart with money... REAL SMART with money(in-game currency, of course.), you can have the cool cars and the cool payed weapons that everyone else has, throuth the use of an in-game community marketplace. the problem is, of course, is that you cannot customize stuff you buy off other players, so i reccomend chatting with car designers to purchas something off them that they can tailor to your wants! my 190 hours and my current status say something, though...i have couple cool cars that make drifters, but i am nowhere CLOSE to getting a payed weapon... i dont see myself ever getting one.If you are new to the game you can always contact me in-game (Lolfungreg for enforcers of LFGames for criminals) and i can help guide you through the game and hopefuly halp you gain a good amount of revenue. just hope i am online.Oh yea! I forgot to Talk about the refer-a-freind program....... That is actually one of the only good bits of the game. It pretty obvious how it goes.]Send a bud your email]Your bud will then make an account and character through that emal]You play missions together and help your bud finish tutorials]Look in the refer a freind page, to see what points you have. (You of course gain points by playing with your freind and helping him finish tutorials)] You can then gain FREE acces to premium and paid-only Weapons, Exclusive cars and Bodykits, Weapon skins, and Clothing using your points :D.The refer-a-freind program REALLY benifited me through this game, and in the end actually really brought me back into APB. Give it a try, see how you like it!

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 20, 2014
												This game kicks♥♥♥♥♥.. literally... it kicked my♥♥♥♥♥so hard i'm currently writing this review. So lets get to it! APB: Reloaded is a pretty complex game but lets just say that if you are a fan of GTA, this game will blow your mind! Mine was, because the game has tons of variety of customization! Paint your car, Get your Enforcer a tattoo, make your own badass logo and once you've made your logo apply it to your shirt on your Enforcer while doing missions in a massive Third Person shooter scale. But it's not just about shooting♥♥♥♥♥♥up. As a Criminal you can rob pedestrians for money, jewels, electronics and other needed stuff. And while we are on the subject of the Criminal side let's talk about it. Mostly daily races in 2 open world maps for you to look around and find these hidden passages so you can decide "Am I really going to drive on the highway or get into the tunnel as a shortcut?". This game has variety and it's what makes APB so unique! However the main flaw of this game is that it's not very fun when going alone, infact it can be downright boring so i suggest that you get a friend or join a clan right at the start of the game because it's so much more fun. And it lacks a story on how these factions ended up fighting each other. Or well you actually get to see that when looking at the Enforcer and Criminal cinematics wich looks amazingly beautiful. This game is beautiful when it comes to graphics. And the gameplay is hell of alot of fun! As a Criminal I robbed an electronics store while an Enforcer sees it and then a mission begins where i need to drop off my stuff at a very different place than the original drop off. And the guns and rifles in this game looks, feels and sound powerful as hell!So with that being said, this game earns a 9/10! If you are a fan of Shooters, shooot em up games, GTA and even first person games you will find APB a game that fits into your library.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2014
												Oh my. APB Reloaded.This game has a learning curve unlike most other in the FPS genre.There will be blood, sweat and tears in your first 30 hours of playing, from getting nuked to orbit by OSMAW noobs and continously ramming your sweet Charge Cisco into a wall every time you try to make a turn at a somewhat decent speed.But once you get a hang of the games mechanics, and learn to snipe even the kids with their parents credit cards, this game gets really fun.Because you've been through it yourself, you can almost feel the frustration of the enemy, when you go 20/0 in a 3v3 capture mission, wrecking them everytime they try to make a play.This game takes commitment. You have to put in a good amount of time, to get even somewhat decent at the game, and everytime you think you matter, another challenger comes along, and puts you right back where you belong. I love it.

number of helpful: 1 person found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 31, 2014
												Have you ever had a moment in your life where you're excited and ready to go? Starting APB was like that for me. I made my character, grabbed a gun, and went out into the world of gang violence.Much like real gang violence, I was repeatedly brought low by people who bought better weapons than I could, could use the same weapons I had to better effect, and was matched up in a 'fair' fight against people who were like gods to me as an ant. even my car could best be described as a thin plastic shell around a chunk of explosive that functioned as an engine. Within 16 hours of gameplay, I had made every possible worst decision, from choosing a shotgun with the spread the size of a small house, to attempting any sort of PvP at all when close-quarters fighting meant gangbangers instantly ending my life repeatedly with SMGs and sniper rifles, while assault rifles were used to pick opponents off from 100 meters away. Any attempt at buying improved weaponry to escape the hellish catch-22 of ranking up to get new weapons was met with a paywall, and those who bought these rank-exempt weapons were unto demigods in their own right, as these 'same but different' weapons had the characteristics of their real life counterparts. Which, of course, meant they could actually kill you, unlike the peashooters and feather guns regular players are given. All in all, it's the standard Korean MMO pay-to-win format, but with guns and cars. Good if you need to be humbled or have the reflexes of a supercomputer.

												You want an honest to god review.  Here you go.ProsTime Waster.Brainless shooting.Sometime... fun.Not really P2W.  Some weapons are out of wack and OP. But you can deal with it, if you counter correctly.  Cons.Community is garbage.Admins are non-existant.Anti-cheat system (That took who knows how long to get installed): Works, But crap.Engine hasn't been updated since its beta release.  Still running unreal 1 or 2?Cheaters, alot of them.  NOW let me iron out this cheater business before someone that plays rages.  There are alot of people using cheats as a crutch. Snipers can be big on this.  So these people are rarely caught.  Once in a while someone 'big' gets caughtOne Pro, in this.  Some cheaters are really bad at the game... I really cant explain why anyone plays this game for what it is.  Its more self punishment on a bad day.  You will have alot of bad days on this game like that. For years at least that I have played.  G1 swears they are for the player.  But they do lovely money grabbing things.SUCH AS.... there is a paymarket for weapons, cars, etc etc.   There are plenty of these p2w type packages.   BUT... besides they they package up items that no one is using in attempts to sell them at a discount for a money grab.Mean while they have been working on Console version rather then even attempting to deal with there current community, problems, and issues.There is also typically only four 'levels'  Two mission maps, and two fight club maps.  There is also a holiday christmas map, that was orginally one of the old fight club maps.  THEN There is the social district.   Which is a number of small gangs of people on voice.  MLG proing it, trash talking, playing hidious isrealie, hindu, arabic, kpop, jpop, more less anything you hate to hear at a horrible bit rate, and 28000hz of sound range.   YOU CAN hear it in social.  But there is some hope.... its in the customizing you can do in the game.   (WHICH of course, you need premium to do...better. )   You a Furrie? Put on them cat ear, bunny ears, color them thing, body pant yourself.  Boom!  Want to be a mad max road warrior.  Take one of the armored vehical (ONLY ON ARMAS the pay market! TM) slap some rust textures, get your clothes ready, and grab a shotgun. (GOOD ONES ONLY ON ARMAS!)   Want to be a pink rubber suit super mouse? content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												I have played APB:Reloaded for 4 years total with 2920 hours in game (i dont use steam a whole ton hence ~1k hours.) Great game, great customization. Completely free to play, there is 0 PTW at all. Premium only gives benefits to customization, and aftermatch bonuses. Everything on ARMAS is reskins, early progression, weapon skins, and clothing and vehicle kits. Weapons are well balanced within their niches. Its a little difficult to get a handle on when starting, but find some friends, join a clan, and it becomes a lot better! It has significantly gotten better with the implementation of FairFight (Don't believe most of the claims in chat that someone is "cheating", most times they actually aren't), and seems that it will only get better.I recommend this game to players who wish to challenge themselves, can easily learn from their mistakes, and learn from their enemies. As well as players who enjoy customizing their characters, as it has some of the best customization options I have seen in a game so far.Game also uses a bit of Ram 8gb will do just fine, anything less will probably get frustrating.See you in San Paro!

content:
Posted: August 31, 2014
												APB Reloaded is a mass-multiplayer "sorta open world" third person shooter/objective based game. I find it very fun in my opinion and even better when you're playing online with a good group of friends. The objectives vary, and I find them enjoyable as well as not too reptetative, the only problem I think this game has is that the enforcer role seems to be a little too OP when they are equiped with a tazer/stun gun. I know people counter this by stating that criminals do make money quicker, but I still think that the stun gun is rather unfair. However, this is just my opinion and someone else may feel differently towards it. But, if massive-multiplayer, online, third-person shooters sounds exciting to you, than this game is perfect.

content:
Posted: March 4, 2015
I would like to start by saying that APB Reloaded is not a great game for everyone.It requires patience in order to enjoy it, so I would not recommend it for seriously competitive gamers.With that said, APB Reloaded is probably my favorite long-standing game. As of writing this, I have played for well over 500 hours, over the course of a few years. What's it like?APB can sort of be described as GTA Online. Essentially, you have a cops vs. robbers (Enforcers vs. Criminals) faction scenario, with the player selecting their side. Once you've selected a faction, server, etc., you can create a character. NOTE: APB offers excellent customization options. There is an in-game radio that you can use to import music, character, clothing, and vehicle customization studios with quite a bit of freedom, and several modifications available to influence your character, vehicle, and weapon abilities.There are also plenty of weapons to choose between in the game, so you can build a loadout that suits your playstyle.APB can become very competitive though, so it is recommended to bring a large amount of patience with you when you play! All in all I do recommend the game as I've found myself repeatedly coming back to it.
