content:
Posted: January 24
												Short and to the point:  APB Reloaded is far from "just another FPS game."  It's a multiplayer open world free to play game, featuring big city maps, fast cars, and city crime!  It's where we all want to live right?  A cop or  a criminal are the choices with plenty of customizations and role playing too.  APB Reloaded offers good eye-candy, and the graphics are amazing.  AI and game physics are top notch.  My personal favourite, is listening to my tunes in a stolen car, and launching it off the overpass.  There are plenty of complexities for seasond gamers, and beginners will find it easy to get started, but I will warn you now, it's not for junior.  The game features heinous crimes, nasty language, and skimpy cloathing too.  Just the way us adults like it - right?   Well then, I'll see you in the Social District!

If you like causing or stopping chaos or police roleplay you will like this game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												This game is a pretty standard example of how to milk a game for all it is worth using already existing assets.I was an original player from back when the game was owned and run by Real Time Worlds (R.I.P) and published by EA. I was one of the first batch of players to play APB Reloaded during the closed beta period. After open beta is began it's continuous downward spiral.Pros- Customization, it's nearly unmatched in the options for customizationsCons- Poor community and lack of in-game moderating; griefers, hackers and inappropriate behavior that isn't punished.- Dominated by in-game microtransaction system; you'll rarely find people that play consistently who don't spend money in some form. It's not impossible to play without paying, takes a noticeable amount of time for it to be worth it.- Unoptimized.- Poor matchmaking; back during closed beta there weren't districts that were divided by 'threat level', so often times higher ranked players would get matched against many more people than were in their group. I consider that a step up to what is currently in the game.- Poor spawn system; pretty easy to push on a spawn so the enemy spawns farther away, and car spawners have completely ruined the dynamic of the game.

content:
Posted: April 17, 2015
												Greetings,Here we find the explanation of development and how it's supposed to and not-to work. Here we see a great concept, but the game's amongst one of the poorest methods of executions. It's been floating around for about 6-years, it's dissapeared and re-appeared, regardless; not much has changed on it. It's free-to-play, so if you wish to give it a try, go ahead. It's a fun game with friends, sadly it looks too much like a money-grabbin' development team but no clue do I have. Either way, recently as of 2016 mentions of new directions & paths for this game to embark have been set, but this promise has been made many times (2011-2016) through many formerly responsible people of APB's development, administration & moderation team. But let's hope it takes the right way into further growth.Kindest regards,Nick.

content:
Posted: March 19, 2014
												This game has it's fair share of issues... It's one of those 'Pay to Win' games with korean style web-browser RMT-shop. Hackers run rampant and even if you manage to play with legit players, you will be (Seriously, you WILL be. Matchmaking sucks due to low player population and crappy code) decimated by them because they are far more experienced and  better geared than you. Also, you will get against clans a lot, so prepare for that if you are ever going to give this game a shot. It's buggy, it feels cheap, missions get repetitive after a while and everything sucks.Well, not everything. I enjoyed thoroughly the many customization options APB has. Sticking decals to yourself and to your car is more fun than it seems at first. You also could do even your own songs and 'themes' using an ingame music studio. But don't get too excited, you are not going to be able to explore all of it - some extremely useful features are locked behind a paywall.Bottom line: Unless you are ready to pay for 'premium' - membership (Yeah, this game has a 'subscription', by subscribing, you can get your hands on more content which you cannot access as a normal player) and for some OP-weapons (Which can cost as much as 40 - 60€ and more EACH) , don't buy this game. In my opinion, there are better things (GAMES) to spend your money on.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
												I played a lot of APB back in the day.It was fun at first, but then I noticed something was odd...It's a bloody Pay-2-Win. With money and experience multipliers sold for crazy prices.Actually no, let me rephrase that. It's not a Pay-2-Win, it's a Pay-2-Do-Anything-Fun-And-Win.You want a shirt that doesn't look like crap? Buy it for 5€.Need an awesome pair of cargo pants that goes well with the 5€ shirt you just bought? But it for 10€.You want to customize your car you worked so hard unlocking? That'll be 60€.Want tattoos on your body, decals on your car or clothing, or a decent gun? Hand over the cash.This, is not a game. This is bloody cancer.It attracts you with its price tag of FREE, but then you have to deal with being the lowest rank possible simply because you just couldn't spend 15€ on that OP gun you get for only a week or so.And then, there's the community. Oh god, here we go...Most of the time you do end up either against or with an hacker during missions. And what did G1 do? They added a fun little thing that just spams the chat saying "Cheater was banned from Server". Couple of hours later, there's 5 of them.The community is absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Toxic, cancer, to say the least.You win a game fairly with good teamwork? Get hackusated. And reported.And while on the topic of teamwork, yeah. There's none.Most of the time it's just a bunch of kids screaming and shooting randomly, or seasoned players who decide it's a good idea to become Silver (mid-level) and play on Bronze (low-level) servers to farm money and XP.And then... The so called "Social District Mannequins".These players, or shall we say "♥♥♥♥ing statues", just log into APB, go to the Social District, and do absolutely NOTHING.They just stand there. With their custom clothing. Trying to convince people into buying their stuff through the in-game marketplace.These... Subjects, can take up space in the Social District for hours and hours, just doing nothing.Now, on to the last part of the Community: Everyone looks exactly the same.And I really mean it. Here's a list of what you'll find in APB.Males: Army dude, shirtless dude, cat, japanese styled dude, naked dude. Always with maximum muscles.Females: Army♥♥♥♥♥♥ bikini-wearing♥♥♥♥♥♥ cat, japanese styled♥♥♥♥♥♥ naked♥♥♥♥♥♥ Always with ungodly huge♥♥♥♥♥♥From a game with this amount of customization, you'd expect weird things going on, like rednecks on pickup trucks, rich dudes in suits, hobos covered in dirt, poor people in rusty cars... Instead you get cats driving sports car with a top speed of 80km/h (50MPH) and Soldier-wannabes in huge Military Grade SUVs.I expected a lot more from a game with USABLE INDICATORS, amazing character customization, and awesome concept.But it seems that money is GamersFirst's number one priority. And that ruined a pontentially awesome game. It could have given GTA V a run for his money...

All in all 8/10 imho.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 29, 2015
												This game is a pretty standard example of how to milk a game for all it is worth using already existing assets.I was an original player from back when the game was owned and run by Real Time Worlds (R.I.P) and published by EA. I was one of the first batch of players to play APB Reloaded during the closed beta period. After open beta is began it's continuous downward spiral.Pros- Customization, it's nearly unmatched in the options for customizationsCons- Poor community and lack of in-game moderating; griefers, hackers and inappropriate behavior that isn't punished.- Dominated by in-game microtransaction system; you'll rarely find people that play consistently who don't spend money in some form. It's not impossible to play without paying, takes a noticeable amount of time for it to be worth it.- Unoptimized.- Poor matchmaking; back during closed beta there weren't districts that were divided by 'threat level', so often times higher ranked players would get matched against many more people than were in their group. I consider that a step up to what is currently in the game.- Poor spawn system; pretty easy to push on a spawn so the enemy spawns farther away, and car spawners have completely ruined the dynamic of the game.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 29, 2014
												The game itself is GOOD.But if you don't have the time to grow a thick skin and overcome a steep learning curve, you will not enjoy it, and you should likely not bother.I'm NOT recommending this game until some major change will transform the game into something better. I would love so much to do it, but I don't feel like I should right now.Update from Nov 18th 2015 - meh, still not that much of an improvement.Still a harsh game to learn, still requires to be thick-skinned. If you don't take it seriously you can still have fun, though.Update from Apr 25th 2017 - signed up almost seven years ago. Long gave up to at least bring myself to be done with character ranking up. Character and gear customisation is still almost unmatched by anything else for me. But the actual game is far too neglected by devs and scarcely populated by players. This is not a game you play with a passion, not anymore at least.If I cared nothing about my characters and the amount of time and resources I spent on them, I'd have been saying "close this game already" long before now.

content:
Posted: May 20, 2015
												One word to describe my experience in this game : HackersAnother player openly admitted he was running hacks during gameplay and then proceeded to highlight every other player in the server running them for me.  I didn't believe them at first but then after seeing what they could do there was no doubt these players are running hacks.I thought when I saw the huge green banner saying "Fair Fight" that is what I would get... WRONG!!It is a Pay 2 Win game loaded with Hackers and Whales.  The lag is so bad that I thought my keyboard was messing up but nope-- turns out all driving input is tied in with your latency so if you get a bad ping spike (which hackers exploit to no end) your vehicle becomes 100% uncontrollable.Avoid this game at all costs.  I would say to buy GTA V instead but they have the same issues and others with a worthless customer support team who avoid responding to tickets via any loophole they can think of even when not based on factual information.Great game concept APB has .. terrible delivery.

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 22, 2016
												I played a lot of APB back in the day.It was fun at first, but then I noticed something was odd...It's a bloody Pay-2-Win. With money and experience multipliers sold for crazy prices.Actually no, let me rephrase that. It's not a Pay-2-Win, it's a Pay-2-Do-Anything-Fun-And-Win.You want a shirt that doesn't look like crap? Buy it for 5€.Need an awesome pair of cargo pants that goes well with the 5€ shirt you just bought? But it for 10€.You want to customize your car you worked so hard unlocking? That'll be 60€.Want tattoos on your body, decals on your car or clothing, or a decent gun? Hand over the cash.This, is not a game. This is bloody cancer.It attracts you with its price tag of FREE, but then you have to deal with being the lowest rank possible simply because you just couldn't spend 15€ on that OP gun you get for only a week or so.And then, there's the community. Oh god, here we go...Most of the time you do end up either against or with an hacker during missions. And what did G1 do? They added a fun little thing that just spams the chat saying "Cheater was banned from Server". Couple of hours later, there's 5 of them.The community is absolute ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. Toxic, cancer, to say the least.You win a game fairly with good teamwork? Get hackusated. And reported.And while on the topic of teamwork, yeah. There's none.Most of the time it's just a bunch of kids screaming and shooting randomly, or seasoned players who decide it's a good idea to become Silver (mid-level) and play on Bronze (low-level) servers to farm money and XP.And then... The so called "Social District Mannequins".These players, or shall we say "♥♥♥♥ing statues", just log into APB, go to the Social District, and do absolutely NOTHING.They just stand there. With their custom clothing. Trying to convince people into buying their stuff through the in-game marketplace.These... Subjects, can take up space in the Social District for hours and hours, just doing nothing.Now, on to the last part of the Community: Everyone looks exactly the same.And I really mean it. Here's a list of what you'll find in APB.Males: Army dude, shirtless dude, cat, japanese styled dude, naked dude. Always with maximum muscles.Females: Army♥♥♥♥♥♥ bikini-wearing♥♥♥♥♥♥ cat, japanese styled♥♥♥♥♥♥ naked♥♥♥♥♥♥ Always with ungodly huge♥♥♥♥♥♥From a game with this amount of customization, you'd expect weird things going on, like rednecks on pickup trucks, rich dudes in suits, hobos covered in dirt, poor people in rusty cars... Instead you get cats driving sports car with a top speed of 80km/h (50MPH) and Soldier-wannabes in huge Military Grade SUVs.I expected a lot more from a game with USABLE INDICATORS, amazing character customization, and awesome concept.But it seems that money is GamersFirst's number one priority. And that ruined a pontentially awesome game. It could have given GTA V a run for his money...

Posted: March 1
												Pros: Lots of Pay2Win playersLots of CheatersLots of Toxic players(LoL players are angels compared to players here)Lots of Lag/rubberbanding(Servers aren't maintained AT ALL, similar to Firefalls last days)VERY Unoptimized Game EngineYou will rage, you will start developing high blood pressure, anxiety, etc. (Real Talk) I developed Anxiety over this♥♥♥♥♥♥ my doctor even wanted to prescribe me VALIUM. Yes I'm Serious. This game gave me so much stress it gave me Anxiety(and a quite a few of its related symptoms)Addictive like Heroine, beware, you know its HORRIBLE for you but you just keep playing.Cons: Less than 20% of the playerbase is legitUninstall works but only if you have the will to delete this abominationLook i know what your thinking, you're thinking the hundreds of bad reviews are just salty gamers.Do yourself a favor. JUST AVOID THIS GAME LIKE THE PLAGUE.It is pure cancer, its FILLED with Cheaters, might i say MAX RANK Cheaters, because theres absolutely NO INGAME Moderators. The customer service Is TERRIBLE. The anti cheat protection is horrible. The only reason you may see someone get banned on announcement is because they tried injecting a really old cheat. But this game hasn't updated neither its anti cheat software nor the game itself in a LONG TIME.The community is extremely toxic. Those that don't cheat but are really good is because they're the typical Cash shop buyer. YES THIS GAME IS Pay to win! Don't even try to defend it! It just is. it is extremely pay to win, some players will argue theyre just weapons reskins but this is an absolute lie. The cash shop weapons are 10x better than the ingame earned ones. Only like 20% of the current playerbase is actually legit. SERIOUSLY JUST AVOID IT. This company has a HORRIBLE reputation for a reason. YOU'VE BEEN WARNED.

content:
Posted: April 27, 2015
												Very bad experience wth this game:Launching this game messes up the whole steam client. Even after i close the game steam still shows it running in my status and everything else, now one would think as to restart the client to fix this but steam does not exit when a game is running, so it keeps requesting me to close the game first before exiting while it is already closed!(Also,you cannot launch the game again as it is already running according to steam)...sticky situation xD. then i have to use the task manager to manually terminate all steam processes and start steam again. Pretty tedious right? and this was just a single issue out of the many this game brings to the system. I could write about more issues but it would make this review too long, so in conclusion: very bad personal experince=would not recommend to anyone.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2013
												Many people consider APB: Reloaded as a P2W game but it really isn't its more skill based you can kill maxed ranked players that own ARMAS Marketplace weapons with the starting gun. The default gun given is the most balanced gun in the game good for long range and close ranged. The Apparent P2W guns are obtainable for rent without paying but require Joker Tickets which you can obtain from fight club. Honestly I feel like this game is not P2W more like you need Skill2Win I would recommend APB to any other gamer out there.      People also forget the positive parts about APB: Reloaded which includes the games detailed character design. The customization in APB is by far one of the best due to the ability to make individual symbols and then place those symbols anywhere on a piece of owned clothing, car or graffiti. Regarding the Symbol editor you have amazing artwork for purchase from other players with in game money that could be tattoos, clothing details, car logos, anime characters, nsfw, guns, and other things. Positives:- Great customization- Fun- Mailbox at Social District- That nice tingling sensation when you beat a maxed rank gold- Combat is more strategic then a point and click to kill shooter- GM's hold events occasionally and distribute GM Joker Boxes- Fight club for those who like instant action- Variety of guns in which each gun counters another just got to be smart on what you chooseNegatives:- About 1/3 of the cool clothing is armas- The fastest car in game with nitro is as fast as a potatoe (Feels like the max speed is 100kmph)- Occasional server lag- In game 13 yr olds that teabag- occasional hacker      Overall I rate APB: Reloaded 8/10

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 5
												English :The most effective/accurate word to define this game is just : "Aids".-Very ♥♥♥♥♥♥ optimization : Even high-end pcs can't run this game at a constant 120 fps atleast.-Low skill capped gameplay and mechanics : Even though they are great, you can just go easy on everyone just by pulling out a simple oca and litteraly♥♥♥♥♥♥them by adding CJ3 on it.-Really low population : This game isn't really well known which leads to a mostly ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ community. (Around ~1k players in the Eu servers and near ~500 in NA servers)-Erm, cheaters everywhere : Used to have 2 anti-cheats, but the first one failed and just started randomly banning people and the second one is slow af and actually commits to false bans during 'events'. Hopefully, this game's staff eventually unban people.-Overpriced Marketplace (in my opinion) : 700$ for the latest "Loyalty Reward" weapon. Near 40$ for any single accountwide weapon. Worth it? I don't know.-♥♥♥♥♥♥ content lately : *Still waiting for the engine update announced for 2k14* Latest packs of the game are being just more and more horrible, especially for car kits, and of course really expensive.People used to say 'It's a low cost GTA'? ♥♥♥♥♥ please, this game cost me around 2k$.BUT I have to say, this game has some good points.+Awesome customization of cars, characters, clothes.+You can actually make pretty cool artworks out of your 3D models thanks to a little part of the community.+It's not a p2w game, or atleast 75% of the Marketplace guns are just reskins of free in game weapons.I played this game kind of too much. I liked it a lot, wasted a lot of my time on it, but still I wouldn't recommend it because of ALL the bad points of it.Français : Le mot le plus efficace/précis pour définir ce jeu est : "Cancer".-Super mauvaise optimisation : Même le plus gros pc ne peut pas faire tourner ce jeu a 120 fps constant au moins.-Une mécanique de jeu relativement simple et facile : Même si elles sont bien, il n'y a qu'à prendre une oca pour rouler sur tout le monde, on peut même lui mettre CJ3 pour littéralement violer les joueurs.-Très faible population : Ce jeu n'est pas très connu et c'est pourquoi il est peu peuplé (aux alentours de 1000~ joueurs dans les serveurs européens et seulement 500~ aux Etats-Unis) et fatalement la communauté la plus débile de ce jeu se retrouve plus en avant par rapport au reste.-Hum, des cheaters partout : Il y avait 2 anti-cheats à la base. Mais 1 est parti en couille et s'est mis à ban tout le monde et a été retiré et le 2eme est juste super long et en vient même à fasle ban les joueurs pendant des events. Heureusement, le staff du jeu unban les personnes concernées.-Un Cash Shop trop cher : L'item le plus cher que l'on puisse avoir monte a 700$ (soit ~649€). Chaque arme coûte aux alentours de 40$ (soit ~37€) pour une arme permanente pour son compte. Cela en vaut-il la peine? Je ne sais pas.-Un contenu très mauvais récemment : Les packs de ce jeu deviennent de plus en plus horrible, surtout pour les kits de véhicules, et bien sûr très chers. *On attend toujours la mise à jour du moteur graphique annoncée en 2014*Les gens disaient "C'est un GTA gratuit"? Mon cul ouais, il m'a coûté aux alentours de 2000$.Mais je dois quand même dire que ce jeu a de bon côtés.+Une customisation exceptionelle des voitures, des personnages, et des vêtements.+On peut en plus faire de beaux artworks avec les modèles 3D grâce à la petite partie de la communauté de ce jeu qui y sont plutôt dévoués.+Ce jeu n'est pas p2w, ou plutôt l'est très peu. Seulement 75% des armes du Cash shop ne sont que des imitations des armes gratuites en jeu.J'ai passé beaucoup de temps sur ce jeu, environs 4/5 ans, et c'est un jeu que j'ai beacoup aimé. Mais je ne le recommande vraiment pas à cause de tous les mauvais points que j'ai cité plus haud. C'est dommage, ce jeu avait de l'avenir.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 21, 2014
												APBR takes place in a sandbox style overworld inhabited by players from two opposing factions (Criminals and Enforcers) It's essentially a 3rd person open world shooter, often described as Grand Theft Auto if it were a MMO. The two types of players are pit against each other in missions such as... X tries to steal N while Y tries to stop them. The experience you have while playing is going to vary based on who's online. Some days, servers are empty and often you will play missions uncontested which is easy but not very exciting. Other days servers are full, there is activity everywhere, and you'll have other players opposing you every time. Unfortunately, as with many other online games, these players are often mean spirited, and can vastly outclass anyone new in both skill and equipment making this a pretty intimidating game to take on. But when the fights are fair and you have a friend along, it can be an experience which is both fun and intense.If you care about customization, then look no further. ABPR has a very refined character creator that is worth the download in itself. But once your character is established, there is still a lot you can do with it. There is a clothing, tatoo, graffiti, and even car customizer made possible by one of those -put shapes together to make art- interfaces. (though sadly, much of the content for them is locked at the start of the game) But if that isn't enough, you can even write a little 4 measure theme song (that can play 6 tracks with multiple chords at once!!) to have other players hear when you win in a mission! (And you can also write full-length songs with it that can be shown off at the local dj booth) AND you can import your own soundtrack to the game itself from your computer. All of these interfaces are pretty user friendly and fun to use. If you would play for no other reason, the editors themselves are certainly something to be impressed with. The freedom that ABPR gives you to saturate your experience with user-made content is certainly a step forward for gaming in general. Even though the multiplayer experience isn't always a good one, I'm very happy that I got to experience this.

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
OverviewGameplay: 2/10Sounds: 5/10Multiplayer: 6/10Graphics: 7/10Pros & Cons+ Limitless customization from characters to even theme songs+ Decent map design- Possibly the worst gun mechanics in any shooter game to date- Glitches- Horrible car control- Unbalanced weapons- Bugs- All monetized items cost waaaaay too much. (50 USD for a weapon)- Stiff animationsConclusionAPB is one of those strange games that manage to have a handfull of really great aspects and basically fail at everything else. The developers (Gamersfirst) do not listen to fans and sadly it reflects in the game. The animations are awful, the ragdolls feel like plastic bags, the streets are paved with invisible ice causing cars to slide everywhere, the gravity is set to reflect the moons' and don't even get me started on the gunplay. APB certainly has grown since RTW, but there are TONS of room for improvement. 5/10

												I love the customization and everything. The only problem is, the community is more toxic than a nuclear meltdown site, the game is clawing at your wallet 24/7, and the fighting is ♥♥♥♥♥♥. Honestly, I would play it from time to time, in between 10 hour sessions of TF2 or whatever, but...well...here's the thing. I once logged on to APB, wanting to just♥♥♥♥♥♥around for an hour or whatever. I get the infinite loading screen glitch, and I haven't been able to play since. content:
Posted: December 20, 2013
												Unfortunately I'm going to have to say this with a heavy heart. I do not recommend APB Reloaded. I put a lot of hours into this game and while it can be irritating it is really fun; but here's the kicker: once you're leveled up enough you then deal with hackers. In order to continue to play and actually have any decent fun, you need to hack yourself. It sounded dumb and at first and I did not believe the person who told me so I kept playing. But over the next couple of days I realized he was right. Not only do the players hack but while I played all the servers were hacked as well and these actions made it almost unplayable. The idea is great and the gameplay is great; but all the constant hacking done do this game ruins the fun. If it weren't for the hackers I'd highly recommend this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 21, 2016
												THIS GAME OMFG WHERE DO I BEGINi havent played this vid game for like two or three years now but omg it was such a weird time in my life.i played this on what might be the equivalent of a 2016 calculator. an older laptop (even for the time) intended for things like emailing and microsoft office and pewdiepie videos. it ran decently enough to let me log 300+ hours across 4 or 5 accounts. about a fifth of that time was spent customising my characters and cars though, and two fifths was spent looking for a fkin game. the matchmaking was horrible. i was a silver (i should have been gold but fkin retard teammates ♥♥♥♥♥) and so naturally id be paired up with fellow silvers and sometimes bronzes, but way too often id be put up against golds who were absolutely insane at the game. maybe it was muscle memory but golds were usually really good at the game and any gold v gold games were nice to watch on twitch back when this game had something of a following. i dont think i ever encountered a hacker but tbh i usually just messed about in the game because it was such a dumb game at times. equipped with my trusty beanbag launcher id go around stunning baddies, and outside of that, me and my guild/clan would /race/.racing was sick. cars controlled as if they were on ice. not to mention that they would slip around on the roads so much that any car with significant torque could do a backflip by accelerating too quickly. it made the races way more worthwhile because you actually had to know how to drive in this game. it wasnt a mindless "press w and follow the road" thing, you had to actually adjust your speeds and steer appropriately and not abuse your max speeds or else youd f*cking regret it. it was beautiful and loads of fun, especially when servers had this half-off mode which made cars almost impossible to drive. the jeeps would reer up like horses at the start of a race whenever the servers were like this, and any proper acceleration flipped you upside down. you really needed to drive cautiously.customisation was insane. you couldnt mess with many polys or anything, you had face and body and that was it. it was outfit customisation that separated the walmarts from the Wangs. clothing cust used a layer system and if you were premium (gay af requirement) you got even more layers, which meant you could make some really intricate designs and even create the illusion of depth depending on your base clothes. i think i just made my femme cop ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and my male character agent 47. nothing insane, because the good stuff took time and effort and my laptop at the time was too garbage for me to wait for loading times. it was pay to win though. not the cc but the actual game. this one gun, which was a mod of a regular gun, cost G1Cash, and it pretty much broke the game for a couple of weeks. The "Whisper" as it was titled was cancer, and G1 didnt really balance it out probably because people were buying it for easy k/d. you could buy blatantly op guns and modded cars and even character mods with real moneys and it just cheapened the game at times. i didnt pay for a thing and had some fun but im pretty certain if the stuff in the armas marketplace was made available to everyone (but obviously not just handed to us) that id have had a way more varied and meaningful time in missions. its probably why i just stuck to driving my car around the financial district for the most part, because drifting was also pretty satisfying.i would have rated this a 6 or 7 out of 10, but the bar seems to have dropped way lower at this point. i doubt g1 can salvage it since their long list of fkups will soon be the demise of the Amazon, but honestly this game is incredibly addictive, and with the way the corporate bossman behind it treats its players, id say thats a bad thing. dont do drugs

content:
Posted: February 22, 2016
OverviewGameplay: 2/10Sounds: 5/10Multiplayer: 6/10Graphics: 7/10Pros & Cons+ Limitless customization from characters to even theme songs+ Decent map design- Possibly the worst gun mechanics in any shooter game to date- Glitches- Horrible car control- Unbalanced weapons- Bugs- All monetized items cost waaaaay too much. (50 USD for a weapon)- Stiff animationsConclusionAPB is one of those strange games that manage to have a handfull of really great aspects and basically fail at everything else. The developers (Gamersfirst) do not listen to fans and sadly it reflects in the game. The animations are awful, the ragdolls feel like plastic bags, the streets are paved with invisible ice causing cars to slide everywhere, the gravity is set to reflect the moons' and don't even get me started on the gunplay. APB certainly has grown since RTW, but there are TONS of room for improvement. 5/10

												Disreguard my input hours, i spent at the least 30+ hours before making a steam account and installing thru here. I know people like to whine "oh but you only played a little bit you barely even know how good the game is" kinda thing. Anyway.   This game is, to put it bluntly, a pay to win "free" version of Grand Theft Auto. Not in a good way. The people who have a free account like me (i dont really feel the need to spend money on a "free" game, i dont really play competitively) constantly are reminded about the "advantages" to upgrading which isnt really that annoying, but it gets in the way sometimes. Almost like a mobile game ad, just close it and youre okay. The worst part of this game is how much of an advantage the people who spend 100+ bucks on this game have. Theres little level ones going up against people who sold their ♥♥♥♥in girlfriend off just to buy a few overpowered guns and weird clothes. You want to see a pay to win? Play this game. Not to say it isnt fun, however. Its pretty deep customization-wise. Its almost reminicent of the way saints row 3 had the customization options, as you can change almost anything on your character, make your own tattoos (even though they usually end up looking like bubba gave you a free tat in the prison cell unless youre good with the in game creator), customise clothes down to putting decals on them and stuff,  even the cars can be pretty customised too. You can bump your own music that you have on your computer while driving your car, which i think is the coolest thing since sliced bread. They really need to level the playing field for people that dont want to spend 100+ dollars on a supposedly "free to play" game. I know free 2 plays make their money in that way with all the stupid microtransactions and♥♥♥♥♥♥ but this game is one of the absolute worst p2w games i have played. Pair that with all the annoying Brazillians who lag the game out and have no clue what theyre doing and you get APB: Reloaded.Pros:CustomizationReplayabilityCons: EXTREME pay to win aspectToxic CommunityHard to level up/ earn money unless significant time is invested

content:
Posted: March 12, 2014
												Oh APB....better known as ALWAYS PLAYERS BlTCHING.Tutorial: Covers almost nothing besides basic movment.Grahpics: For a game released in 2010, it looks decent, however it is very poorly optimized and basic system requirements will net you about 5 fps.Gameplay: Honestly? It at times can be great, and other times it makes you rage so hard your skin turns green. Between the hackers (which some people will refuse exsist in this game) the tryhards, and the game just downright screwing you over, you will get mad at this game.Playerbase: Filled with trolls and children.This game is basiclly a GTA MMO. And being F2P they have done a great job keeping it from being P2W. Now on the downside, there are hackers like any other game. Only problem is, those are the same hackers who have played for YEARS. The next issue is the massive egos players have and the complete cesspool community. Played EVE? Imagine that and multiply it by 100. Yeap, that bad. If you can get passed the ignorant children and the known hackers, this game is hands down the best game I have played. I have around 4500 hours, don't let steam fool you. It wasn't always on steam. It's worth a download. APB features much more than just mission based PvP. You can deisgn your own clothing, cars, symbols, music, themes, etc. They also offer fightclubs which is a fast way to get in the action if you only have a small ammount of time to play such a game. Be warned however, the cash shop is VERY over priced. So much over priced a single gun runs you about the price of a new video game. Do not buy anything unless it goes on sale, which happens fairly often.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 16, 2014
												APB: Reloaded is a unique game in a era where most games feel like every other one.  While the game may have some technical problems, the developers are working hard to remedy them and overall improve the quality of the game.  I've played the game since its first beta under Real Time Worlds in 2009, and there is good reason that it hasn't faded into the past as so many other games have.The mission portion of the game is structured so that it seems different almost every time, and you don't get that feeling of repetition that you get with a lot of arena-style shooters.  (CoD, Battlefield, Blacklight)  You may get the same mission objectives, but the game randomizes the locations, your opponents and your teammates (if you don't have a premade group) throughout the zone each time.Combat works as intended, and while it may not be the most modern shooter the game has a lot to offer on the battlefield.  The gunplay is smooth and tactical thinking and teamwork can win over even the most skilled opponents.  Having a good team working together is one of the best parts of this game.There is also, of course, the customization.  There is no game on the market today that allows you to be unique in the way that this game does.  From making stylish threads, music and cars for yourself to making uniforms and patrol vehicles for your clan-mates, you can truly create your own identity here.The game is a bit old, granted, with a somewhat outdated version of Unreal Engine and a lot of custom code at its core.  I'm hopeful, however, as the developers have an overhaul and upgrade planned for the game's engine.  According to the timeline it should be ready for testing by the end of the first quarter 2014, and all reports state that development is currently on schedule.See you on the streets!

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 16, 2016
												Loved this game at launch, but then the devs went bankrupt and the game shut down. Enter GamersFirst, who promised so much and delivered so little. I stopped playing in 2012. Hankering for an MMO and filled with fond memories, I reinstalled it yesterday and played just fine for an hour, then I get a Punkbuster kick for Disallowed Program/Driver. Not a clue what it could be related to because I can't find any log or anything even remotely helpful apart from an old stickied post in the APBR forums telling me to delete the pb folder in the game directory and reinstall pb etc... So, reluctantly, I do just that and now I get kicked every 3 minutes for packet flow. Solution to that? Uninstall pb and reinstall. Did I NOT just do this? So you know what? ♥♥♥♥ it; I'm done.Before I go though, let me tell you prospective players to just stay clear of this travesty; the core of the game is still fantastic, but the game as a whole is just muddled with ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥te added by G1. What is essentially a CTF has it's own lobby, but it almost completely removes vehicles from the equation and the top dogs are the guys with the most OP weapons of the week, because G1 wants their money. If you're a Bronze or maybe even a Silver, you can enjoy access (or not, if it's full) to a lobby that actually is representative of what APB is. If you've hit Gold threat, then good luck finding anything but the aforementioned CTF.If you don't have a top-tier, paid weapon, then prepare to get♥♥♥♥♥♥on by anyone who does. The game has been this way ever since G1 got their grubby ♥♥♥♥♥tained hands on APB, and I am sorry that I ever forgot about that. Also, Punkbuster has been a known issue for this game since 2012, help to sort this issue is not actually helpful, the "known" fixes--if they work--only work for a few days at best before you have to repeat the whole "fix", and... ♥♥♥♥ it; I'm done.

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 31, 2014
												This game only accomplishes one thing, customization. Everything else this game attempts to do is utter failure. Missions/Matches are greatly one sided, the gun play (The MAIN Point of a PVP Shooter) is copy and pace, repetitive, buggy, just flat out boring, driving is exactly what you would expect out of a F2P, “Point A to point B… Yay…” and the game has a community worse than Halo and CoD!All the time I spent in this game equaled to this.70% Raging at a bad match because of how bad of a game this is.25% Sitting in the social area AFK.1% Having fun in a match.3% Fun goofing around in the bland, small open areas (Its not even worth calling a sand box).1% Enjoying the limited customization options for a non-monthly payment account.This game is a perfect example of a horrible Pay2Win game being considered good by morons. Even being a Pay2Win, you’ll still have to level up so slowly to the point where it makes Bad Company 2 level grinding look quick.This game is even a better example than Call of Duty in showing how humans enjoy repetitive, copy and past, garbage.The rating I give this game is a 2/10, not even worth looking at on the Steam Store. Its definitely not worth Recommending to anyone, unless you want them to check if Steam’s Uninstall button is still working.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 11, 2014
												♥♥♥♥♥♥♥it EA.5/10What had the potential to be one of the best shooter MMOs ever made, became a cheater infested Pay2Win game.The game is nice, no question. It has a ton of potential - one that "Gamersfirst" (lol its obviously moneyfirst) doesn´t even scratch at.The character customization possibilites are incredibly huge. You can almost spend hours in these menus.So there´s a huge plus to this game. Unfortunately, all that doesn´t help you when the game frustrates the hell out of any legit player who doesn´t want to pay real money for already present ingame content.The graphics are okay.The gameplay is okay. The movement is quite smooth and the gun handling is also nice. Not too easy, nor too difficult.Why the game isn´t recommendable for anyone who wants to play it seriously: I can say that you will encounter your first cheater within your first five matches and that statement will come true in probably 80% of all cases.I can also tell you that skills don´t matter in this game, because the other guy who paid real money for skills and perks and weapons and equipment and whatnot, will crush you.The game is fun, as long as you aren´t serious about it.Driving around in cars with your friends sticking out their weapons from the windows or doors, robbing stores, mugging people, annoying the hell out of other players and doing all kinds of stupid things with friends really does have quite a nice charm to it.

content:
Posted: February 18
												APB-Reloaded ( ALL POINTS BULLETIN-RELOADED ). About the game :At the start when u login u can chose between : Citadel , Jericho , Hong Kong .After u choose a server u have to choose a faction between '' Criminals '' and '' Enforcer '' after u chose a faction u like u can create your own character ( but u cant move from the servers ).As Enforcer u have two different type of contacts : First ''Prentiss tigers'' and second u have '' Shadow strike ''. If u chose Criminal u have : ''Blood roses'' and '' G-Kings ''. After u created your character u can make the Tutorial or join any district and press T to see tutorial.In this game u have five different district u can chose. First u have '' Financial District '' in this district u can play missions and rank your self , there is two different '' Financial Districts'' first is the one where u can get any threat u want and in the second one u play and doesn't matter if u win or lose you wont lose your threat . Second map is '' Waterfront District '' its similar to '' Financial District '' there is just the map different and u have district when u can lose your  threat and in the second doesn't matter . Third districts are '' Fight clubs '' there are two Fight clubs : First The Asylum and Second Baylan shipping . In this Fight clubs u play to collect special money called Jt ( Joker Tickets ) . With this special money u can go to the last district called '' Social district '' . U can buy or customize clothes , cars .... And if u want special guns or car kits u buy it with your Jt ( Joker tickets ). At contacts u can buy , clothes , cars , weapons , ..... but the weapon u buy at a contact are only for 10 days . In this game exist weapons with open slots where u can put modifications . If u want to unlock them u need rank your ranks with ( Sniper , shotgun.... ) at rank five u get one slot weapon to buy at a contact for 10 days. If u want to have a permanent character or a permanent account weapon you need to buy it for real money on Armas marketplace . The guns u buy on Armas marketplace have 3 open slot or 3 3 already put in  modifications .Personal thinking of this game :Its worth to try it out .

content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
												The game is absolutely incredible. I've read a lot of negative reviews, but I believe most of them aren't justified. People call the game "unfair" to new players. But seriously, the game is no different than any MMORPG out there, you can't start a character on level 1 and expect to kill level 100 players. The difference is a lot smaller though, I've made 17 kills in a mission versus top-level opponents as soon as I started playing the game, with only starter weapons. Other complains are that it's "pay to win", which is also untrue. Basically premium only helps you speed up the process and get money faster to buy weapons, also unlocks more customization options. However the premium doesn't even affect the gameplay, it's mostly like an EXP boost which are being sold in most MMO's. Other complains are that the game is dying. Actually the community is slowly starting to grow back. It gained 16% more players just this month, so the game isn't really dying at all. Some districts are so crowded that it gets even annoying. Another complain is that the community sucks and people are teamkilling eachother. Basically it's no different than CS:GO. When you kill more than 5 teammates you get kicked from the game, so I don't see a problem here.The only thing that I agree with the negative reviews are that the game lags. A lot. I cover up the recommended requirements all the way, yet the game still lags on low graphic time to time. I still don't know what's the problem, but even with lag I can't help it, but enjoy the game. It's just awesome. Tons of customizations, tons of fun, cars, weapons .. everything. I hope the devs do something about the lag issue, then I will count it as the best f2p game ever.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												3000 hours spent over 2 years, 2 characters max rank and many reroll attempts.I won't bother you with my terrible English so let's do it pros and cons:Pros (because there are pros... honestly)+ atmospheric (urban settings even though it does feel like an old game).+ Fast-paced - what I like and hate the most about this game (I'll explain you why).+ Best customization system of all time. Believe me! I've spent hundred of hours in the editor.+ Absolutly NOT P2WCons (ok! I'll go easy on G1):- Infested with cheaters.- Nothing interesting after 1K hours.- Boring clan system.- Toxic (adult yet immature) community.- Unbalanced weapons (Ntec, low yields, NHVR you name it!) But hey! Part-of-the-game excuse! Remember?- Poor customer support - my tip: don't buy anything or no less than 50€ to Gamersfirst. If you get scammed, banned for no reason there's a high chance that the GM who is in charge of the customer support (not even kidding) will kindly ask you to p*** off.- Poor community management: 1 GM for 4 servers (2000 players) ... why not? And don't tell me there's more than one, I wouldn't believe you.Now  pro&con:+New engine's coming soon (Announced back in 2013), Overkill servers on Obeya- No developement in the meantime: APB has been released then shut down then bought then realesed again etc etc. Since 2011 there has been nothing we could consider like game developement. New guns and reskins aren't relevant, we want new cars, new game mechanics, weapon balance, realistic gameplay (shooting and car physics) and no NHVR jumpshooters Yoloyield spammers please!That's it folks!If I should recommend it? Yes but make sure you have at least a good friend to play with you ... and something else to help keep calm.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 26, 2014
												Well there are some goods and a lot of bads. I'll start with the goods and end with an in-depth overview.Goods:-EXTREMELY vast customization options (though limited by lack of Premuim)-Fantastic Social/'chill out' District-Very easy to use and grasp-Decent backstory-Simplistic-Potentially great teamworkBads:-Hello hacker city-Pay to win-Customization limited by Premium/P2W-Godawful driving (the action-reaction delay is horrific)-Very awkward controls-It's on PC instead of console-Too many kids to count-VERY CPU instensiveOverview:Basically, APB is a simplistic, visually stunning, F2P MMO very much alike Saints Row. The variety of weapons and vehicles is nice, the customization is second to none and actually tops Saints Row and any other MMO and the gameplay is addictive, racey and smooth. Though the game does have a tendency for lag spikes.Sadly, I feel the bads outweigh the goods. The ratio of hackers/cheaters to legit players is 50/50 or MORE on the hacker side unless you play with newbies. The P2W and Premium feautures of the game are disgraceful. You will be MILES above the rest if you purchase with real money - and a LOT of it. This also sadly limits the lovely customization. The benefits and potentially essentials you get from  Premuim are completely unfair and a rip-off for what they charge.The community for the game is frankly disgusting, too. Primarily due to it's fanbase being kids, low-esteemed 'girlgamers' and social-networking rejects. Expect to be called a noob and whined at in a moments notice and don't be suprised if the chat seems like it's been taken over by an army of 14yr old scene kids and CoDfans. The marketplace is lacking within this too. I would say that "Gold Threat" players are far worse than any whiney tryhard in a CoD hacker lobby. Avoid them at all costs.Verdict:Unless you're wealthy and willing to spend a good $120 on this 'F2P' game, willing to play with the newbies (which isn't bad at all), speak Russian, want a social MMO or have a bunch of clan-mates to play with, I would not waste time and memory with this game. It is extremely CPU intensive and addictive. Otherwise, gold-threats avoided, this is rather fun.

content:
Posted: July 29, 2014
												Apb Reloaded is a fast pace PVP game. Its supposed to be atleast. The game Has many different customizations so your character will hardly looks the same as the guy next to you (usually). Ther are also many car customizations. There are a few cars but not so many. Ther are a few guns but they hardly introduce new guns, its usually the original guns with buffed statts and etra mods for it. There is not an anti cheat engine. Less Hackers = More fun. There will obviously still be hackers but there is alot less hackers. This game is easy for people who have a good aim with good reactions and a good pc. I run this with about 15 fps, smallest res and min graphics. I wouldnt be writing this review if i hated it. I LOVE this game so much and i reccomend it to everyone.People Claim that this game is Pay to Win. This game is NOT pay to win. Everythign can be unlocked or bought of the in game auction market in the Social district. The game now has a tutorial which if completed, You can pick a permanent weapon instead of payign for one. People pay monet to this game for an extra edge but it only comes down to skill (apart from people with a launcher :P)-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------10/10Fave Game in my steam Libary (yet not played alot XD YOLO SWAG)

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 10, 2014
												probably one of the worst games i've ever played. i was obsessed with it pre-release, and even upgraded my computer in the hope the game would run better.it still runs averagely, and they've had a long time to maybe fix some of the unreal engine issues. the company that holds the game must pay for a skeleton crew of patchers and programmers, because the dlc is nonexistent and the ingame store is lackluster as far as desirable perks go.most customization is unlocked when you log in, though you still have to 'earn' patterns. many people complain about how the limited texture layers are, and other things, but i don't care for all that.i have clocked more time in this game than better titles, mostly because i can't help that i love the format. the server-side driving might feel disgusting to some people, but adapting to constantly inconsistent driving controls should be a gamer skill at this point.don't play it.i recommend it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 21, 2013
												This is a great game if you can with stand the trashy community. Overall, there's quite a bit of things that need fixing, and are currently in the process of being fixed. It has countless amounts of replay-ability and can easily be considered one of the most addicting games i've played. Customizability is great, however they continue to offer a premium service (Which is kinda needed.) The market place system makes it seem as though the game is pay to win, but overall it's not. You need to put a lot of time into this game to have an enjoyable experience. And by enjoyable i do not mean crashing cars into other cars until they explode.If i were to give this game a rating out of ten, at least an 8/10. It's worth the try and if you can't seem to get into it, well, find something else thats up your alley.

Well, what´s the Problem about a level 255 in the enemie team if you´re only level 25? So, let me tell you... They have Modifications for Weapons and the Character you dont have, like... More Life or Faster Health Regeneration. For the Guns they have thing like: More Range or Higher Firerate. I dont even had a Chance with a Weapon i bought for 5€, because my enemies have Rocket Launcher (It´s like 120 hours of play time you need) or an Enemie has a much better buyed weapon than you... Let´s talk about the Atac, it has a good range, a high Fire Rate and is killing you in close range with like 5-6 Hits, yes, its a good weapon if you want to spend money, but if you get better then the most other Players, you will get nice enemies with a SMG and a 100% Precision on distance, it makes a lot of fun. Buy a Hack for 10€ and i swear to you, you´ll get better in this game then any other player and I think you wont get banned, otherwise i cant tell you why there are like 2-3 ppl in every high ranked mission which just come by car, cant see you, just jump out of the car, making a 360° and killing you with any weapon.Oh, did i mention? I get enemies with Rank 255 and I´m Rank 25. Well done, G1, well done you just ♥♥♥♥ed up a matchmaking and are not able to fix it after like 2 years.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												APB Reloaded.... Hmm where to start.Well APB is a great pvp game with GTA feeling to it.Basically you choose your side, good or bad, (cop or criminal) then you get pvp missions to complete throughout the maps.all missions are fairly similar and they get old pretty quick but the game is about pvp, not missions.lets say your a criminal. you get a job to go spray paint, or steal something, so you drive/run to your destination.interact witht he object (takes like 30-60sec or so) as you are trying to intereact the cop players will get missions to stop you. and the battle commences.You can change your looks quite a bit, and get your very own vehicle,. which there are a bunch.The game is pretty fun while it lasts, but it leaves me wanting SOO Much more.This is mainly because it reminds me so much of GTA (Grand Theft Auto) that i want to beable to enter buildings, and go to the casino, and do PVE missions with friends.  All in All the game is fun, try it. and I believe games like this one helped push Rockstar into making GTA online.so once again now that GTA online is out (and coming to PC soon at the time of writing this) i think a lot of APB players will be migrating to GTA online.

content:
Posted: February 20, 2014
												I really, really want to love APB (All Points Bulletin): Reloaded more than I do. Yes, the original APB was riddled with enough cracks and flaws to take it from diamond-in-the-rough to half-eaten-Ring-Pop-that's-shaped-like-a-diamond, but some of its more ambitious ideas were very nearly brilliant. And hey, Reloaded – for the most part – smartly tweaks APB's little problems while leaving its cops-and-robbers core undisturbed. On paper, it sounds like every wannabe grand automobile thief's dream come true. So then, what exactly went wrong? Above: If only he'd just worn his safety beltThe short answer: A lot of things. First, though, it's essential to point out what went right, because – without a doubt – APB: Reloaded is a more enjoyable experience than its short-lived predecessor. APB's DNA – once a criss-crossing-crashing amalgam of MMO persistence and barely functional riffs on GTA's best ideas – has been straightened into a much finer point. Weapons now do more damage, resulting in faster, more satisfying firefights. Cars, meanwhile, actually possess unique driving models. In other words, no more sports cars that drive like minivans. There's also a teensy bit of weapon-usage-based stat progression to give you something to do beyond amassing a gun collection that'd make even John Woo's bullet-loving doves flee in terror. And then there's a real-money-based in-game store that... well, more on that in a bit.In a lot of ways, APB fights desperately to be the antidote to modern MMO drudgery – sometimes to a fault. Beyond rudimentary side objectives (things like raiding stores if you're a criminal or returning stolen cars for enforcers), the game is essentially PVE-free. Missions auto-plop you into a group of fellow ne'er-do-wells (or loose cannon cops who don't play by the rules) and assign you objectives – for instance, investigate a vehicle or commit some nice, wholesome arson. The twist, however, is that your enemies aren't trash mob NPCs - they're flesh-and-blood members of the opposing faction. So missions unfold more like objective-based shooter matches, but in a completely open, vehicle-packed urban playground.  When APBR works, it really, really works. There's nothing quite like racing neck-and-neck against a sports car full of gangbangers – guns-a-blazing the whole time – toward an objective, crashing and twisting through the air like you've been punted by Godzilla, and then emerging from the wreckage into a hail of gunfire and, er, regular fire. Other MMOs, meanwhile, ask you to collect 20 boar gizzards because, f*** you, don't question it, chore peasant. Better still, similar chaos unfolds all around you, thanks to other groups on similar – though separate – missions. Bullets fly. Cars careen through the streets. Magic happens. Before long, though, you can't help but see behind the curtain of explosions and car shrapnel, because that's pretty much all there is to it. Mission types are incredibly limited, generally breaking down into “find and deliver a thing,” “stop the other team from finding and delivering a thing,” and “hold a point for a really long time.” New self-contained “Fight Club” districts attempt to spice up the rather vanilla proceedings with large-scale team deathmatch and king of the hill battles, but the two currently available maps lend themselves more to haphazard lone wolfery and camping than interesting team tactics. APBR's city, meanwhile, is utterly lacking in the loving attention to detail of, say, a GTA or the zany outlandishness of a Saints Row. It's just a sprawling sea of gray spotted with shamefully tiny islands of intrigue. So, by and large, APBR devolves into a very simple shooter with very simple modes in a very simple environment. On top of that, the story's basically non-existent. Occasionally, your contracted mission-givers will send you emails, but there's no sense of escalation or progression. It's just an unending tug-of-war between cops and robbers that never actually goes anywhere – a dynamic justifiable only if APBR is secretly set in Purgatory.    That general lack of personality becomes all the more disappointing when you start really digging into APBR's absurdly robust character customization suite. Once you've filled out your wardrobe and unlocked a few decal templates, anything's possible. So, of course, we created something that could best be described as the unholy offspring of Batman Beyond and the mopiest, most blue-haired JRPG character you can imagine. At one point, we actually encountered an incredibly authentic Harley Quinn – jester cap and all – and it was love at first sight. Then she shot us in the face. Long story short, APBR's players supply nearly all of its personality. And while that's an interesting idea on paper, it fails to thaw a frozen, unchanging world whose bag of tricks is about as deep as a drought-devoured puddle. But what about all that free-to-play razzle-dazzle that APB savior GamersFirst can't stop clamoring about? Business models, after all, can make or break MMOs. And while APBR's “Armas Marketplace” certainly isn't broken, there are some very worrisome cracks in its armor. For one, the game constantly pestered us about biting a $10 bullet and signing up for a month of Premium access, and it's not hard to see why. Among other things, our piggy bank's valiant sacrifice more than doubled our end-of-mission cash rewards, hugely boosted our faction gains with mission givers, reduced cooldowns, and gave us a 20% discount on all marketplace items. Basically, Premium's the way APBR was meant to be played. Free, by comparison, feels downright sluggish. Then there's the extremely sticky issue of buyable weaponry. Armaments that cost you an arm and a leg aren't necessarily better or worse than those earned by the sweat of your tattooed brow; they're merely different variations on similar ideas. So, ultimately, a kitted out character and someone who upped their arsenal the old fashioned way will be on a roughly even playing field after many hours of play. However, we were able to roll a completely fresh character and immediately buy a fully modded gun that many experienced players swore by. Suddenly, getting matched against fellow low rank players didn't seem so fair. APBR's early goings, then, can be a figurative trial by fire and bees. Because the fire wasn't bad enough. APBR is a game that suffers from a serious identity crisis. It tries to be both an emergent, skill-based shooter and a full-blown free-to-play MMO, but only succeeds at falling into the abyssal middle ground between the two. Thanks to a number of tiny tweaks and larger additions, Reloaded is definitely a step up from the practically DOA APB that crashed and burned a couple years ago, but the two are still incredibly similar. Fundamental mission structure and variety flaws, unfortunately, stuck around for the ride, and its (improved) simplistic shooting and driving aren't enough to right those wrongs. It's honestly heartbreaking, because many of the game's ideas teeter on the cusp of being revolutionary. As is, however, All Points Bulletin: Reloaded fires far too many blanks. Free is a tough price to turn down, but the city of San Paro is – at best – a vacation spot. We simply can't recommend an extended stay.

content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												Despite the numerous negative reviews. On this game, I killed a lot of time, and to me it is still like that.Most of the reviews I've read, are associated with a large number of cheaters, bugs and occasional updates. (But if you think it is easy to keep the game of this magnitude on the old engine, which also want to update, and it's not a secret).At the expense of cheaters - they are almost there, there are players who play better, and the rest just do not have the nerves. (There were many occasions when they wrote me that I am a cheater, even a couple of videos available)Bugs - well, it's mostly because of the engine. Some events simply can not be processed on slower machines.Actually, how can you not love a game where you can almost do anything. Huge customization and hours spent in drawing characters.They Donate, as without him in the MMO game? I played for a long time without premium or other stuff. I did not stop  to play. And recently the developers gave the keys 1-3 days premium tied to holiday dates.The game may seem difficult in the early stages, as not an ordinary mechanics and physics of fire, the ability to look through the corners of the walls, and not just knowledge map.I still remember one summer evening when I and my friend had nothing to play, we decided to download APB. When we did not even know what to do, but we have developed, made a Role-play (one gunner, sniper and machine gunner), buy cars and created a gang that fought with everyone.Since then the game has changed a lot, removed some of the roof, which is constantly hiding all (where it was impossible to kill VIP) was added to the aero cars (some believe that it is simply an opportunity to knock out users more money, but enough to buy once, and you can making machines to order, if you know a little draw in the editor), and of course clothes for a unique character.The game is demanding on resources and often freezes, but this is the reason the old engine with a huge structure that simply can not be maintained well. It's just a matter of time. (I played on secure servers, where the server and test new stuff, there were all just fine.)In general, this game I really like and I do not regret the time spent in it.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2014
												After playing from the original APB Real Time Worlds to GamersFirst's version, I can say that the game is broken, but not neccessarily in a bad way. It is what it is, and its a complete work-in-progress with on going updates to fix what will never be fully repaired.With that said, the customization of character creation is really the only reason why I continue to play the game. Without that core feature I would have never put so much time and money into the game.If I had to rate it as of now, I'd rate it a 6/10 due to how long it takes for me to be put in a mission (driving around for 10 minutes majority of the time waiting to be set against other players.) and the fact that instead of fixing things they more than less end up breaking it.It's not a noob friendly game so if you're new to the game, hopefully you've played counter-strike 1.6 because its more "click click" than hold down the button and hope to kill the other person.6/10 but I still recommend anyone that likes to customize from clothes, cars, characters to music to give it a shot. Again, one of the reasons why I play this mess of a game is because past memories from RTW and customization.

content:
Posted: June 13, 2014
												Ok, this is my first review, but I will try my best. APB:Reloaded. I dare think that, after several hundreds of gameplay, i still enjoy this game. It has some good and some bad sides, like any other game. First of all, it has a HUGE customization capacity: you can customize nearly everything of your character and car. Unfortunately, its matchmaking system is the biggest flaw. I am a gold threat player, and I am forced to play in Silver threat districts, for the gold ones are almost empty. Some p2w weapons surely exist, but they can be defeated with teamplay (it is a must: a good team is the most important thing) or with some excellent f2p weapons, like Colby PMG. So, if you can find a good team you enjoy playing with, this is one of the best f2p games I enjoyed so far. Anyway you should have a badass computer, and a relly good connection: expect lag if not. A whole lot of it. Be ready for sad moments, but also for a lot of fun if you want to play apb.I hope my grammar was correct. Now the servers should be back online, so see you in the game!

content:
Posted: December 7, 2013
												APB Reloaded.... Hmm where to start.Well APB is a great pvp game with GTA feeling to it.Basically you choose your side, good or bad, (cop or criminal) then you get pvp missions to complete throughout the maps.all missions are fairly similar and they get old pretty quick but the game is about pvp, not missions.lets say your a criminal. you get a job to go spray paint, or steal something, so you drive/run to your destination.interact witht he object (takes like 30-60sec or so) as you are trying to intereact the cop players will get missions to stop you. and the battle commences.You can change your looks quite a bit, and get your very own vehicle,. which there are a bunch.The game is pretty fun while it lasts, but it leaves me wanting SOO Much more.This is mainly because it reminds me so much of GTA (Grand Theft Auto) that i want to beable to enter buildings, and go to the casino, and do PVE missions with friends.  All in All the game is fun, try it. and I believe games like this one helped push Rockstar into making GTA online.so once again now that GTA online is out (and coming to PC soon at the time of writing this) i think a lot of APB players will be migrating to GTA online.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 30, 2015
												This is a "cops and robbers" 3rd person action game. The focus is that you and your team either commit criminal acts; including arson, theft and graffiti; or try and stop the opposition doing so. The game splits down the middle between Criminal and "Enforcers" in the fictional city of San Paro.The gameplay is fast. Mixing assorted weapons and vehicles against time-limited objectives.The character customisation is very good, though more could be added.The community is... well, it could be better. /ignore and /report commands are going to be useful to you.You are more likely to see hacking accusations than actual hacking as the gap between a very good player and an open hacker is quite fine. Gamers first and Reloaded productions are doing their best, but it's an uphill struggle.I'd recommend APB: Reloaded but with a caveat; Don't spend your money on the weapons until after the engine and security upgrades.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 7, 2016
												Not exactly Grand Theft Auto, but if it was, I wouldn't need to play to find out where it goes. The freedom to roam the streets as either Criminal or Enforcer is enticing, like playing Cops and Robbers except I actually get to riddle them full of holes.Criminals can keep busy doing all kinds of things, breaking into store fronts and stealing merchandise, mugging people on the street, stealing vehicles and turning them into chop shops for a finders fee, making that money. Enforcers on the other hand kind of get the short end of the stick. With few opportunities to make money outside of missions, progression obtaining better gear is a good bit longer, but without Enforcers, Criminals would have no one to fight. I think that Enforcers could use a bit more of a pick-me-up.Guns. Honestly, outside of vehicular manslaughter, this is your only kill option, and frankly, I get bored with just guns. I would love to sneak up behind those Crims and put a blade between their ribs. So many opportunities would have been mine if there were a melee option.Third person point of view kind of hurts the excitement a little bit, it's difficult to really pinpoint the reason behind it but I always feel a good bit more control in first person perspective.Driving is a challenge, but I actually like it that way, learning all of the nuances to different vehicles, knowing when to start turning, take your foot off the gas, and put it back on to make that absurd u-turn, all the while laughing because everyone else is smacking into the walls, trying to catch up. Learning curves are sick...Movement and running are okay, no real complaints, but interacting with the world? Doors, ladders, fences etc. is very primitive. You can Only climb from the bottom of the ladder to the top or vice versa, instead of being able to sit on the ladder from the perfect vantage point and open fire, or waiting for the perfect moment to climb that last rung. The only barriers you can climb over are predesignated chainlink and wooden fences so entries and escapes can only get so creative. Doors, you can only kick, you can't open slowly and maintain anonimity. The worst thing about it all I think, is that your name is brightly displayed over your character, even if only a hair on the top of your head is visible. No sneaking up in this game.Story? There's supposed to be one, but personally I think it along with the missions and gameplay lack any real depth and character growth. It's basically glorified Team Deathmatch.Temporary guns. To get anything permanent, takes tons of grinding. I'm not even going to get into this.Customization? I think that Second Life could have done a lot better if they followed this games rules on customization, giving you basic shapes to work into your own design. This allows for great degrees of creativity, matched with a lack of graphic-produced lag, making for a comparitively fluid, yet personal experience. Just be sure to go into the customization with patience and a solid plan, and it'll come out great.ProsCustomizationDriving challengeFreedom to roamConsPrimitive movementGlowing namesNo meleeLack of depthI think I'll keep playing on and off because it is a fun game, but I am actively looking for a replacement on my list, so let me call this a tentative recommendation.
